entries: Starting at 6th level, you can begin to see the path you must take to bring your plans to fruition. When you start your turn with one or more Influence Points, you gain temporary hit points equal to twice your current Influence Points.

While you have temporary hit points from this feature, you can transfer these temporary hit points to another creature that is the target of one of your psionic abilities, or the beneficiary of your Seeing power.

subclassFeature.name: Window of Opportunity
entries: Starting at 10th level, you can see the flow of battle, giving time to exploit openings and opportunities.

When a creature you can see misses you with an attack, you can use your reaction to make a weapon attack against that target or use a psionic power against them. When using a psionic power with this reaction, you cannot expend psi points to empower it, but can use Influence Points.

subclassFeature.name: Mastermind
entries: Starting at 14th level, once per turn, when you use your Seeing power, you can select two beneficiaries of your power. Psi points spent are unique to each target affected (and not shared between them).

entries.name: Glimpsed Future
entries: When using Glimpsed Future, you can still use Mastermind to target a second creature, but neither benefits from the bonus damage or damage reduction.

subclassFeature.name: Eschatological Conclusion
entries: Starting at 1st level, when you select this tradition and gain your powers through exposure to the void, you select how to embrace the end of existence, granting you a measure of resolve to continue, and granting you one of the following powers.

entries.name: Conclusion of Annihilation
entries: You learn the acid splash and decaying touch cantrips, and learn the following spells at the following levels. The spells are Occultist spells for you and do not count against your spells known.

entries.name: Conclusion of Madness
entries: You learn the message and minor illusion cantrips, and learn the following spells at the following levels. The spells are Occultist spells for you and do not count against your spells known.

entries.name: Conclusion of Tranquility
entries: You learn the guidance and resistance cantrips, and learn the following spells at the following levels. The spells are Occultist spells for you and do not count against your spells known.

subclassFeature.name: Void Gaze
entries: Starting at 3rd level, as a bonus action you can unveil the void's reflection within your eyes for 10 minutes. When you unleash this power and as a bonus action on each of your turns for the duration, you can direct this power at a creature within 60 feet, with an effect depending on your Eschatological Conclusion selection.

items: {@b Conclusion of Annihilation.} Make a ranged spell attack. On hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} force damage.

{@b Conclusion of Madness.} The target must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. On failure, the target takes {@damage 1d4} psychic damage and the first attack against them before the start of your next turn has advantage.
{@b Conclusion of Tranquility.} The target gains {@dice 1d8} temporary hit points.

entries: While this effect is active, you gain the ability to see through both natural and magical darkness as if it were bright light for a range of 60 feet, and are immune to the {@condition blinded} condition.

You can use this power a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier, but each time you use it again before completing a short rest you must make a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw. On failure, you become {@condition blinded} until you complete a short or long rest. While {@condition blinded} in this way, you have a blindsight of 10 feet.
You regain all uses of the feature on a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Empowered Gaze
entries: Starting at 6th level, the effects of your {@subclassFeature Void Gaze|Occultist|KT-CLL|Voidwatcher|KT-CLL|3|KT-CLL} are empowered, and you add your Wisdom modifier to the damage or temporary hit points of the effect.

subclassFeature.name: They Watch
entries: Starting at 14th level, when you use your {@subclassFeature Void Gaze|Occultist|KT-CLL|Voidwatcher|KT-CLL|3|KT-CLL} ability, you can create up to three spectral eyes at points within 60 feet of you, each of which last for 1 minute or until you dismiss them as a bonus action.

Each eye projects a 30 foot cone in a direction of your choice. You can see through these eyes into their cones of vision as if you were seeing from your own eyes. When a creature starts its turn in or moves into the gaze of a spectral eye during its turn, you can subject them to the effect of your {@subclassFeature Void Gaze|Occultist|KT-CLL|Voidwatcher|KT-CLL|3|KT-CLL} from that eye (each eye can effect a creature once per turn).
Once you use this feature, you cannot create spectral eyes in this way again until you complete a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Witch
entries: A Witch can be many things, and most often refers to someone that villagers find scary and weird, but at the heart of every crazed story there's a sliver of truth. That truth is that Witches do indeed exist.

Some may openly live as they are, while others may be the last person the superstitious villagers would expect. Varied in their powers, designs, and traditions based on their Coven, generalizing about a Witch is challenging. They are most often defined by the varied and utilitarian magic they use, hexes that make crossing them unwise, and powerful intelligent familiars.

entries.name: Witches & Gender
entries: While the term "witch" is often used to refer to a female spellcaster in contrast to a male "warlock," the Warlock class is certainly available to any gender and the same is generally true for the Witch subclass.
Various settings' lore and mythos may make assumptions about gender for witches, but by their very nature PCs tend to be the exception to rules. This subclass is not limited to any particular gender.

subclassFeature.name: Battlemage Technique
entries: In the versatile world of the Spellblades, the Battle Mage is the paragon of balance, mastering both martial prowess and arcane artistry. Standing at the crossroads of might and magic, you represent the perfect synthesis of these two ancient disciplines.

A Battle Mage is a force of constant adaptability, prepared for every eventuality. With your arcane might and martial skill in perfect balance, you stand on the battlefield as an embodiment of strategic might, showing that the pen and the sword can indeed be one.

subclassFeature.name: Battlemage Spells
entries: You learn the following spells at the following levels. The following are Spellblade spells for you, but do not count against your spells known.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Warrior
entries: Starting at 3rd level when you select this archetype, whenever you finish a long rest, you can touch one weapon that you are proficient with and that lacks the two-handed property. When you attack with that weapon, you can use your Intelligence modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls. This benefit lasts until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Quickening Surge
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you gain a new option for your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Spellblade|KT-CLL|1} feature:

items: You can cast a Spellblade spell with a casting time of one action as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Twin Surge
entries: At 7th level, when you use {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Spellblade|KT-CLL|1}, you can select two of the available options.

subclassFeature.name: Surge Mastery
entries: Starting at 15th level, when you use {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Spellblade|KT-CLL|1}, you gain enhanced results:

items: {@b Arcane Sight.} When you cast {@spell detect magic} with your Arcane Surge, you also gain the effects of {@sense darkvision} and {@spell see invisibility}.
{@b Arcane Accuracy.} When you gain advantage on attack through {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Spellblade|KT-CLL|1}, you can reroll one of the attack's dice once.
{@b Arcane Prowess.} When you add your Intelligence to a Strength or Dexterity ability check, you gain advantage on the check.
{@b Extended Teleportation.} When you teleport, the range you can teleport is increased by 10 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Unlimited Surges
entries: Starting at 20th level, you can enter a state of perfect arcane resonance for 1 minute (no action required). During this state, using {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Spellblade|KT-CLL|1} does not consume a use of Arcane Surge (you can still only use Arcane Surge once per turn).
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Aether Blade Technique
entries: Aether Blade Spellblades make use of their magical techniques to create a weapon of pure arcane power, with most of their abilities revolving around mastering the use of this weapon.

subclassFeature.name: Aether Blade Spells
entries: You learn the following spells at the following levels. The following are Spellblade spells for you, but do not count against your spells known.

subclassFeature.name: Aether Blade
entries: Starting at 3rd level when you select this archetype, when you roll initiative or as a bonus action at any time, you can manifest an oversized melee weapon of pure force energy. This can take the shape of any bladed melee weapon, but it is a one-handed weapon that deals {@damage 1d10} damage with a range of 5 feet regardless of its form.

When you attack with this weapon, you can use your Intelligence modifier (in place of your Strength) for attack and damage rolls. This weapon lasts until you let go of it, become incapacitated, or dismiss it as a bonus action.
While this weapon is temporary and magical, it counts as having a value of 1 sp for purposes of being treated as a material component in spells.

subclassFeature.name: Aether Enhancement
entries: As a ritual taking 1 hour, you can absorb the power from a magical weapon with a bonus to attack and damage rolls. This cannot target artifacts, sentient weapons, or cursed items. At your DM's discretion, this might not work with other weapons depending on their origin and type. This drains the power from the weapon, leaving it as a mundane weapon, but your {@subclassFeature Aether Blade|Spellblade|KT-CLL|Aether Blade|KT-CLL|3|KT-CLL} gains the bonus to attack and damage rolls previously possessed by the magical weapon.

subclassFeature.name: Empowering Surge
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you gain a new option for your Arcane Surge feature:

items: You empower your {@subclassFeature Aether Blade|Spellblade|KT-CLL|Aether Blade|KT-CLL|3|KT-CLL} (no action required) causing it to deal an additional die of damage until the end of your next turn. During the effect, you can reroll any weapon damage dice from your Aether Blade once (you must use the new roll after doing so).

subclassFeature.name: Aether Great Weapon
entries: Starting at 7th level, the aether weapon manifested by {@subclassFeature Aether Blade|Spellblade|KT-CLL|Aether Blade|KT-CLL|3|KT-CLL} grows larger and more powerful. Its damage increases to {@damage 1d12}, and it gains the reach property.

subclassFeature.name: Channeled Power
entries: Starting at 15th level, you gain the effects of {@subclassFeature Empowering Surge|Spellblade|KT-CLL|Aether Blade|KT-CLL|3|KT-CLL} when you use any of your Arcane Surge effects.

subclassFeature.name: Massive Blade
entries: Starting at 20th level, you can overcharge your {@subclassFeature Aether Blade|Spellblade|KT-CLL|Aether Blade|KT-CLL|3|KT-CLL} for 1 minute (no action required). For the duration, when you attack with your Aether Blade, you ignore all non-magical armor and defenses to treat the target's AC as 10 + their Dexterity modifier for that attack (magical defenses like the mage armor or shield are not bypassed). While attacking in this way with your Aether Blade, your attacks can target up to 2 creatures as long as they are within 10 feet of each other, though if an attack triggers a spell through {@classFeature Spellstrike|Spellblade|KT-CLL|2|KT-CLL}, it does not affect the second target unless the spell can target multiple creatures.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Guardian Technique
entries: Specializing in defending their allies, spell blades following this technique make broad use of abjuration and self-enhancing magics, often specializing more toward their physical skills. They place themselves at the front of combat, but are a highly mobile line of defense.

subclassFeature.name: Guardian Spells
entries: You learn the following spells at the following levels. The following are Spellblade spells for you, but do not count against your spells known.

subclassFeature.name: Guardian Proficiency
entries: Starting at 3rd level when you select this archetype, you gain proficiency in heavy armor and shields.

Additionally, you can use a melee weapon as your arcane focus, and when you do so you can perform somatic components with the hand holding your arcane focus (even for spells without a material component).

subclassFeature.name: Projected Barrier
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you gain a new option for your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Spellblade|KT-CLL|1} feature:

items: As a reaction to an allied creature within 30 feet being hit by an attack or targeted by the {@spell magic missile} spell, you expend a use of Arcane Surge to cast {@spell shield} without expending a spell slot, granting that creature the AC bonus instead of yourself.

subclassFeature.name: Fortifying Surge
entries: At 7th level, when you expend a use of {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Spellblade|KT-CLL|1}, you gain temporary hit points equal to {@dice 1d8} + your Intelligence modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Swapping Surge
entries: Starting at 15th level, when you use your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Spellblade|KT-CLL|1|KT-CLL} to teleport, you can instead swap positions with a willing creature within range, teleporting to their space and teleporting them to your space. When you do so, both you and them gain the temporary hit points from {@subclassFeature Fortifying Surge|Spellblade|KT-CLL|Guardian|KT-CLL|7|KT-CLL}.

subclassFeature.name: Resilient Aegis
entries: At 20th level, you can fortify yourself with magic for 1 minute (no action required). For the duration, you have resistance to all damage. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Swiftblade Technique
entries: The quickest and most deadly of the Spellblades, Swiftblades specialize in mobility, striking from the shadows and withdrawing as quickly as they appeared, favoring lighter weapons and flurries of blows that leave their target dead before it can retaliate.

subclassFeature.name: Swiftblade Spells
entries: You learn the following spells at the following levels. The following are Spellblade spells for you, but do not count against your spells known.

subclassFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: Starting at 3rd level when you gain this archetype, you gain the {@optfeature Two Weapon Fighting Style|KT-CLL}.

entries.name: Two-Weapon Fighting
entries: When you engage in two-weapon fighting, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack.

subclassFeature.name: Swift Casting
entries: Starting at 3rd level you can use {@classFeature Spellstrike|Spellblade|KT-CLL|2} as part of the {@action Attack} action before making a melee weapon attack. You cannot Spellstrike more than once per turn.

Additionally, you can use a melee weapon as your arcane focus, and when you do so you can perform somatic components with the hand holding your arcane focus (even for spells without a material component).

subclassFeature.name: Rapid Surge
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you gain a new option for your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Spellblade|KT-CLL|1} feature:

items: You can expend a use of Arcane Surge to make a single weapon attack (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Relentless Spellstrike
entries: At 7th level, if you miss an attack empowered by a {@classFeature Spellstrike|Spellblade|KT-CLL|2}, you can choose to not trigger the effect. When you do so, your next attack before the end of your turn will trigger it instead.

subclassFeature.name: Vanishing Surge
entries: Starting at 15th level, when you expend an {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Spellblade|KT-CLL|1}, you become {@condition invisible} until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Infinite Strikes
entries: At 20th level, you draw on your magic to hasten yourself to blinding speeds (no action required). For one minute, any time you make a weapon attack with an action or bonus action, you can immediately make another attack with the same weapon.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Mage Hunter Technique
entries: Some Spellblades hone their magical powers for the sake of countering others. They become the anathema of all spellcasters, they fight fire with fire, honing their own magical skills for the purposes of binding and denying the magical powers of others.

subclassFeature.name: Mage Hunter Spells
entries: You learn the following spells at the following levels. The following are Spellblade spells for you, but do not count against your spells known.

subclassFeature.name: Disrupting Blows
entries: Starting at 3rd level, once per turn when you hit a target with a melee weapon, you deal bonus force damage equal to your proficiency bonus. This bonus is doubled until end of your turn when you cast an Abjuration or Mage Hunter spell.
Additionally, your weapon attack rolls bypass the effects of 1st level spells (such as {@spell mage armor}, {@spell shield}, or {@spell sanctuary}).

subclassFeature.name: Purging Surge
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you gain a new option for your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Spellblade|KT-CLL|1} feature:

items: On your turn, you can expend a use of Arcane Surge to end a magical effect or supernatural condition (such as being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}) on yourself (no action required). If the spell is of a level greater than half your Spellblade level (rounded up) you must make an Intelligence saving throw with a DC of 10 + the spell's level to end it. You cannot use this ability if you are {@condition incapacitated}.

subclassFeature.name: Nullifying Surge
entries: Starting at 7th level, you can use {@subclassFeature Purging Surge|Spellblade|KT-CLL|Mage Hunter|KT-CLL|3|KT-CLL} even when {@condition incapacitated}. Additionally, you can project the purging power outwards, expending two uses of Arcane Surge to cast {@spell counterspell} or {@spell dispel magic} without expending a spell slot.

subclassFeature.name: Expert Abjuration
entries: Starting at 15th level, when you have to make a check with your spellcasting ability to dispel or counter a magical effect with {@subclassFeature Purging Surge|Spellblade|KT-CLL|Mage Hunter|KT-CLL|3|KT-CLL} or {@subclassFeature Nullifying Surge|Spellblade|KT-CLL|Mage Hunter|KT-CLL|7|KT-CLL}, you can add your proficiency bonus to the roll.

subclassFeature.name: Mana Void
entries: At 20th level, you can turn yourself into a magical void, devouring and nullifying magic around you. For one minute, you project the effect of {@spell antimagic field} 5-feet around yourself (no action required). You can still cast spells while within this field, but are limited to Abjuration spells and Cantrips. The field does not affect or remove your Aegis effects.
Once per turn for the duration, when you counter or end the effect of a spell, you regain 1 use of {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Spellblade|KT-CLL|1}.
This effect ends early if you become {@condition unconscious}, or you can end it at any time (no action required). Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Spellshot Technique
entries: Spellshots are those that prefer to keep their spellstriking to a safe range, raining death from afar. From arcane archers to magical gunslingers, they are united in their desire to sling spells at a ranged, infusing them into ammunition.
They offer a lot of freedom of mobility, always staying out of reach of their foes or finding the perfect line up to unleash a devastating line of elemental energy.

subclassFeature.name: Spellshot Spells
entries: You learn the following spells at the following levels. The following are Spellblade spells for you, but do not count against your spells known.

subclassFeature.name: Ranged Spellstrike
entries: Starting at 3rd level when you select this archetype, you gain the ability to apply your {@classFeature Spellstrike|Spellblade|KT-CLL|2} to pieces of ammunition as well as melee weapons, and can trigger the spell strike on a ranged weapon attack made with the infused piece of ammunition.

Spells infused into a ranged weapon affect the target of the ranged weapon when fired, but only have a range equal to the range of the spell or the normal range of the weapon (whichever is shorter range). If you attack a target beyond that range, the spell fails and is lost. For spells that create a cone or line area, the effect originates from you as normal.

subclassFeature.name: Distant Surge
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you gain a new option for your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Spellblade|KT-CLL|1} feature:

items: {@b Distant Strike.} When you infuse a spell that targets a creature or line into a piece of ammunition with {@classFeature Spellstrike|Spellblade|KT-CLL|2}, you can expend an Arcane Surge to increase that spell's range to the range of weapon used to fire that piece of ammunition, and remove disadvantage from firing at max range with a ranged weapon.

subclassFeature.name: Transmuted Ammunition
entries: Additionally at 7th level, when you infuse a spell that targets a line, you can transmute your ammunition into the spell effect, releasing the spell in a line from you as if you had cast it, but using your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice) in place of your Intelligence modifier for the spell save DC. When you do this, you add your weapon damage (including modifier) to the spell's damage roll.

subclassFeature.name: Seeking Surges
entries: Starting at 15th level, when you expend an {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Spellblade|KT-CLL|1}, you can add your Intelligence modifier to your next attack roll.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Bolts
entries: Additionally at 15th level, you can always generate ammunition out of arcane force energy when you fire a ranged weapon. When you do so, you consume no ammunition when firing a ranged weapon with the ammunition property, and your weapon damage becomes force damage.

subclassFeature.name: Complete Control
entries: Starting at 20th level, you can enter a state of perfect focus granting you the ability to bend and guide your shots. For 1 minute, your ranged weapon attacks ignore cover (including total cover) as long as there is a path to the target the projectile can travel.

While you are in this state, you can use {@subclassFeature Distant Surge|Spellblade|KT-CLL|Spellshot|KT-CLL|3|KT-CLL} without expending a use of {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Spellblade|KT-CLL|1|KT-CLL} and once per attack if you miss a creature with a ranged weapon attack, you can redirect that attack at another creature within range (making a new attack roll against the new target).

When you redirect the attack with a {@classFeature Spellstrike|Spellblade|KT-CLL|2} effect that requires a save, you can choose if you want to discharge the spell against the target (if it has any effect on miss), or redirect it to the new target.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Rimeblade Technique
entries: As a Rimeblade, you blur the boundary between the arcane and the arctic, wielding your sword with the cold precision of an icicle's edge. Your enemies find no warmth nor respite, only the biting frost of your magic and blade.

Whether born amidst the relentless snows of the far north or touched by the raw, freezing power of the elemental plane of ice, you have carved a path of icy resolve. Your frost-infused strikes echo the merciless advance of winter, freezing foes in their tracks and turning the battlefield into a glacial field of victory.

subclassFeature.name: Rimeblade Spells
entries: You learn the following spells at the following levels. The following are Spellblade spells for you, but do not count against your spells known.

subclassFeature.name: Ice Blade
entries: Starting at 3rd level when you select this archetype, whenever you finish a long rest, you can touch one weapon that you are proficient with and that lacks the two-handed property. That weapon is imbued with frost energy. You can change its damage to cold damage, and when you attack with that weapon, you can use your Intelligence modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls.

subclassFeature.name: Arctic Armory
entries: Additionally, you learn the {@spell ice weapon|KT-CLL} cantrip can cast it once per turn without requiring a bonus action. Any weapon created by that spell is considered under the effect of your {@subclassFeature Ice Blade|Spellblade|KT-CLL|Rimeblade|KT-CLL|3|KT-CLL} feature (even if it has the two-handed property).

subclassFeature.name: Frostbite
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you gain a new option for your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Spellblade|KT-CLL|1} feature:

items: Frostbite. When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend an Arcane Surge to remove any immunity or resistance to cold damage they have and give them disadvantage on saving throws against spells that deal cold damage (including the triggering spell if used with {@classFeature Spellstrike|Spellblade|KT-CLL|2} on a spell that triggers a saving throw for additional effects). These effects last until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Frozen Heart
entries: Starting at 7th level, you gain resistance to cold damage, and gain advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

subclassFeature.name: Winter's Grip
entries: Starting at 15th level, the effect of {@subclassFeature Frostbite|Spellblade|KT-CLL|Rimeblade|KT-CLL|3|KT-CLL} is prolonged each time a creature takes cold damage by an additional round (ending at the end of your next turn). Additionally, when a creature under the effect of Frostbite fails a saving throw against one of your spells that deal cold damage, they become {@condition restrained} until start of their next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Ice Age
entries: Starting at 20th level, you can release a blast of freezing energy that plunges a 30-foot radius centered on you into a state of everfrost for 1 minute (no action required). It has the following effects:

items: {@b Difficult Terrain.} The area becomes difficult terrain for creatures other than you.
{@b Cold Resistance.} Allied creatures in the area gain resistance to cold damage, while hostile creatures lose any resistance than may have to cold damage.

{@b Slowed.} Creatures in the area when you use the ability become under the effect of the {@spell slow|PHB} spell as they start to freeze. Creatures slowed in this way must make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of their turns. On success the effect ends. On failure, they become {@condition restrained} while under the effect. Creatures automatically pass the save if they are outside of the area of effect. You can exclude a number of creatures from becoming slowed equal to your Intelligence modifier.

entries: You can end the effect letting the area thaw earlier at any time on your turn. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Flying Sword Technique
entries: As a Flying Sword Spellblade, you master the art of the floating blade, separating your willpower from your physical body. Your sword is not just a weapon, but an extension of your mind and a manifestation of your arcane prowess.

Born out of a deep understanding of telekinesis and arcane manipulation, your technique combines mental acuity with martial mastery. Whether a reclusive hermit who honed this art in the solitude of your own thoughts, or a prodigy who has broken the conventional boundaries of weapon use, your chosen path is an unorthodox mix of intellect and combat prowess.

subclassFeature.name: Flying Sword Spells
entries: You learn the following spells at the following levels. The following are Spellblade spells for you, but do not count against your spells known.

subclassFeature.name: Flying Sword
entries: Starting at 3rd level, during a long rest you can touch a melee weapon, infusing it magical power. This Flying Sword can be carried or stowed like a normal weapon, or you can ready it, causing it to float beside you. While an Flying Sword is readied, you can make attacks with it as part the {@action Attack} action, sending it out to strike a target.

Attacks made with your Flying Sword are considered melee weapon attacks with the weapon, but you can use your Intelligence modifier in place of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for attack and damage rolls, and you can make this attack against a target out to a range of 30 feet away from you. If the weapon has the heavy or special property, this range is halved to 15 feet; and if the weapon has the light property, this range is doubled to 60 feet.

Spells infused into the flying weapon affect the target of the attack, but only have a range equal to the range of the spell. If you attack a target beyond the range of the spell, the spell fails and is lost.

subclassFeature.name: Phantom Sword Surge
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you gain a new option for your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Spellblade|KT-CLL|1} feature:

items: Phantom Swords. When you make an attack with your flying sword, you can spend an Arcane Surge to make two phantom copies of it that strike other targets within range. The phantom swords use their own attack rolls. On hit, the target takes damage equal to your Flying Sword's weapon damage (including modifier) as force damage.

subclassFeature.name: Sword Flight
entries: Starting at 7th level, your mastery of telekinetic manipulation of your blade is so complete you can command it remotely and even use it as a mode of transport. You can stand on your sword to treat it as a {@item Broom of Flying}, though only you can ride it, and anything being carried by it is dropped if you attack with it.
Additionally, the range of your Flying Sword attacks are doubled.

subclassFeature.name: Phantom Sword Barrage
entries: Starting at 15th level, when you use your {@subclassFeature Phantom Sword Surge|Spellblade|KT-CLL|Flying Sword|KT-CLL|3|KT-CLL} ability, you can create 2 additional copies of your sword (up to 4 total), each of which can strike a different targets within range.
Additionally, if you use any other use of your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Spellblade|KT-CLL|1|KT-CLL}, you can create a single phantom sword copy on your next attack before the end of your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Ultimate Move
entries: Starting at 20th level, master the ultimate move of your style unleashing massive power in an unstoppable strike. As an attack as part of the {@action Attack} action, you charge your sword with mystical power before sending it forward in a burst of power. All creatures in 120-foot long, 15-foot wide line must make a Dexterity saving throw. On failure, they take {@damage 6d6} slashing damage and {@damage 6d6} force damage. On success, they take half as much damage. You can exclude a number of creatures from the area of effect equal to your Intelligence modifier.

If the sword was infused with spell that has an area of effect through {@classFeature Spellstrike|Spellblade|KT-CLL|2} when you made this attack (for example {@spell fireball|PHB}), the spell's area of effect becomes the area of effect of this ability (otherwise the spell is discharged against the first target, treating a failed save as a Spellstrike hit).
Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Spellfist Technique
entries: As a Spellfist, you are the embodiment of raw power and arcane energy, a brawler who channels magic into every punch. Where other Spellblades may wield elegant weapons or conjure dazzling spells from a distance, you understand that sometimes, magic is most effective when it's delivered up close and personal. Your hands are not just weapons, but conduits for your magical force, and your style of combat reflects this, as brutal and direct as it is unpredictably magical.

Whether you're a former street fighter who discovered an innate talent for magic or a spellcaster who decided the best way to channel your power was through physical force, you've chosen a path that combines the cerebral challenge of magic with the visceral thrill of melee combat. As a Spellfist, you're a force to be reckoned with, breaking through enemy defenses with a flurry of magically enhanced punches and turning the tide of any battle with your explosive arcane power.

subclassFeature.name: Spellfist Spells
entries: You learn the following spells at the following levels. The following are Spellblade spells for you, but do not count against your spells known.

subclassFeature.name: Kinetic Magic
entries: Starting at 3rd level when you select this archetype, you master the harmony of kinetic delivery of magic with your fists. Your unarmed strike damage with your fist increases to {@damage 1d8} bludgeoning damage, and it becomes a valid target for imbuing with magic with {@classFeature Spellstrike|Spellblade|KT-CLL|2}. Any time you make an unarmed strike with a Spellstrike imbued, your unarmed strike is considered magical for the purpose of uncovering resistance to non-magical attacks, and you can convert the bludgeoning damage it deals to the spell's damage type when dealing damage.

When you imbue a Spellblade spell that deals damage to an area into your fist, you can use your Strength modifier to calculate the Spell Save DC for that spell (instead of your Intelligence modifier).

subclassFeature.name: Impactful Magic
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you gain two new options for your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Spellblade|KT-CLL|1}:

items: {@b Arcane Impact.} When you knock a target away from you, you can expend a use of Arcane Surge to knock the target 10 feet further away.

{@b Arcane Grab.} When you hit a melee weapon attack, you can spend a use of Arcane Surge to attempt to {@action grapple} or shove the target (no action required). You have advantage on the ability check.

subclassFeature.name: Point Blank
entries: Starting at 7th level, when you use {@classFeature Spellstrike|Spellblade|KT-CLL|2} while grappling a target, you can instead infuse the target with the spell, treating the spell as if you'd automatically hit an infused attack. The target can still save against effects beyond damage, but any saving throw is made with disadvantage.

subclassFeature.name: Brawler's Resilience
entries: Starting at 15th level, when you spend an {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Spellblade|KT-CLL|1}, you gain resistance to all damage until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Unlimited Power
entries: Starting at 20th level, you can channel magic directly into your muscles, causing your strength to surpass all common reason and granting you the following benefits for 1 minute:

items: {@b Supernatural Strength.} Your Strength score and maximum strength score increase by 2.
{@b Splash Zone.} The damage from your {@classFeature Splash Damage|Spellblade|KT-CLL|11} feature becomes a 30 foot cone.
{@b Bounding Leaps.} The distance you can jump becomes equal to your movement speed.
{@b Strength Advantage.} You have advantage on all Strength ability checks and saving throws.

entries: Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Bond of the Elemental Soul
entries: Tapping into the endless power of the elemental planes, these Wardens shroud themselves in harsh primal forces, destroying their foes with their very presence.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Armaments
entries: Starting at 1st level, when you roll initiative, or as a bonus action at any time, you can manifest elemental weapons into your hands, causing them to burst into flames, form icy claws, lashes of lightning, or frozen shields. Select one or two of the following weapons to manifest. You can manifest the same weapon in each hand, or different weapons in each hand. The weapons last until you drop them, summon new weapons, or dismiss them as a bonus action.

entries.name: Primal Flames
entries: You conjure flames around one of your hands. These become a natural one-handed melee weapon that deals {@damage 1d6} fire damage on hit, and has the Light, Thrown (30/90), and Special properties. It sheds 20 feet of bright light and an additional 20 feet of dim light while manifested. When you throw it, the flames reignite in your hand immediately.

items: {@b Special:} This weapon counts as a free hand for the purposes of grappling. When you successfully initiate a {@action Grapple} with it, the target takes {@damage 1d6} fire damage.

entries.name: Frost Shield
entries: You conjure a slab of ice. This becomes a {@item shield|PHB} you can wield in that hand. Summoning the shield in this way equips it. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

entries.name: Icy Claws
entries: You conjure icy claws that grow forth from one of your hands. This becomes a one handed natural melee weapon that deals {@damage 1d6} slashing or cold damage on hit (your choice), and has the Light and Special properties. If the damage die is increased to a d8, it instead becomes {@damage 1d4} slashing and {@damage 1d4} cold damage. You choose which damage type to add your modifier to when you deal damage.

items: {@b Special:} This weapon counts as a free hand for the purposes of grappling. When you successfully initiate a {@action Grapple} with it, the target takes {@damage 1d6} cold damage.

entries.name: Lightning Lash
entries: You conjure a whip of lightning, tethered to one of your hands. This becomes a one handed natural melee weapon that deals {@damage 1d6} lightning damage on hit, and has the Light, Reach, and Special properties. It sheds 10 feet of bright light and an additional 10 feet of dim light while manifested.

items: {@b Special:} If you hit a creature with this weapon you can pull the creature up to 5 feet towards you.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Manipulation
entries: At 1st level, you learn the cantrips {@spell manipulate fire|KT-CLL} and {@spell manipulate water|KT-CLL}.

subclassFeature.name: Innate Magic
entries: Additionally when you select this bond, you gain access to several innate magical abilities by channeling the power of your primal connection.

You gain the following spells at the listed levels, and can cast each spell once without components or spell slots. Once you cast the spell in this way, you cannot cast it again until you complete a long rest. Wisdom is your spellcasting modifier for these spells. You can cast a spell again before completing a long rest by spending 1 + the level of the spell Endurance Dice.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Interdiction
entries: Starting at 3rd level, your Primal Interdiction becomes a buffeting maelstrom of elemental power when you manifest an {@subclassFeature Elemental Armaments|Warden|KT-CLL|Elemental Soul|KT-CLL|1|KT-CLL|Elemental Armament}. The difficult terrain of your Primal Interdiction affects flying creatures within range, and you can select one of the following effects (selecting each time you manifest an Elemental Armament).

items: {@bold Creeping Frost:} Creatures that start their turn within the area of your Primal Interdiction have their movement speed reduced by 10 feet.
{@bold Blazing Pyre:} Fire burns fiercely around you, creatures of your choice that end their turn within the area of your Primal Interdiction take {@damage 1d6} fire damage.

{@bold Static Field:} The first time a hostile creatures moves 5 feet or more within your Primal Interdiction, they take {@damage 1d8} lightning damage. Once this damage occurs, it cannot occur again until the start of your turn.

entries: The damage of the Blazing Pyre and Charged Field effects increases by one additional die of damage at 11th level ({@damage 2d6} for Blazing Pyre, {@damage 2d8} for Charged Field).

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Reflection
entries: Additionally at 3rd level, when you expend an {@classFeature Endurance Dice|Warden|KT-CLL|2|KT-CLL|Endurance Die} to block the damage against a melee attack, the attacker takes cold, fire or lightning damage (your choice) equal to the amount of damage blocked.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Body
entries: Starting at 7th level, you gain resistance to your choice of cold, fire, or lightning damage. When you complete a long rest, you can change which damage type you resist.

subclassFeature.name: Primal State
entries: Additionally at 7th level, you can expend one {@classFeature Endurance Dice|Warden|KT-CLL|2|KT-CLL|Endurance Die} to cast {@spell become fire|KT-CLL}, {@spell become water|KT-CLL}, or {@spell become wind|KT-CLL}.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Form
entries: Starting at 14th level, you can cast {@spell form of fire|KT-CLL}, {@spell form of ice|KT-CLL}, or {@spell form of wind|KT-CLL} without expending a spell slot. When you cast the spell this way, you can cast the spell as a bonus action, and it does not require concentration. Once per turn during the transformation, you can use the action it grants in place of an attack made as part of the {@action Attack} action.
Once you cast the spell in this way, you cannot do so again until you complete a long rest. You can use it again before completing a long rest by expending 6 Endurance Dice.

subclassFeature.name: Paraelemental Interdiction
entries: Additionally at 14th level, when you activate your Elemental Interdiction, you can select two options, activating both effects.

subclassFeature.name: Cataclysm Unleashed
entries: Starting at 17th level, when you use your {@subclassFeature Elemental Form|Warden|KT-CLL|Elemental Soul|KT-CLL|14|KT-CLL} ability, you can instead cast {@spell form of the elements|kibbles tasty:cc}, and are no longer limited to using the action they grant in place of an attack once per turn, as long as you use two different actions granted by the different forms. When you cast {@spell form of the elements|KT-CLL} this way, you can choose to become a Large sized creature for the duration of the spell.

While in this form, the damage dice of your {@subclassFeature Elemental Armaments|Warden|KT-CLL|Elemental Soul|KT-CLL|1|KT-CLL|Elemental Armament} and {@subclassFeature Elemental Interdiction|Warden|KT-CLL|Elemental Soul|KT-CLL|3|KT-CLL} effects are doubled.
Once you do this, you cannot do so until you complete a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Bond of the Beasthide
entries: Tapping into the primal ferocity of beasts, Beasthide Wardens are capable of fighting with a primal ferocity. They specialize in unleashing terrible wrath on any that would attack them or their companions.

subclassFeature.name: Bestial Claws
entries: Starting at 1st level, when you roll initiative or as a bonus action at any time, you can manifest one or both of your arms into clawed natural weapons. You cannot wield weapons or shields in hands that you have morphed, but they can be used to {@action Grapple} creatures. While you are grappling a creature with a claw, that claw can only attack that creature. The claws last until you dismiss them as a bonus action.

entries.name: Bestial Claws
entries: A vicious set of claws extending from one of your hands. This becomes a natural one handed melee weapon that deals {@damage 1d8} slashing damage on hit, and has the Light and Special properties.
{@b Special:} This weapon counts as a free hand for the purposes of grappling. When you successfully initiate a grapple with it, the target takes {@damage 1d6} slashing damage.

subclassFeature.name: Bond of the Wild
entries: At 1st level, you gain proficiency in Animal Handling. If you already have proficiency in Animal Handling, you gain expertise in the Animal Handling skill, allowing you to add twice your proficiency bonus to checks made with it.

subclassFeature.name: Innate Magic
entries: Additionally when you select this bond, you gain access to several innate magical abilities by channeling the power of your primal connection.

You gain the following spells at the listed levels, and can cast each spell once without components or spell slots. Once you cast the spell in this way, you cannot cast it again until you complete a long rest. Wisdom is your spellcasting modifier for these spells. You can cast a spell again before completing a long rest by spending 1 + the level of the spell Endurance Dice.

subclassFeature.name: Ruthless Interdiction
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you have advantage on the first attack roll or {@action grapple} check you make against a creature that attacked anyone that was inside the range of your Primal Interdiction (including yourself) since the end of your last turn.

subclassFeature.name: Enduring Ferocity
entries: Additionally at 3rd level, when you roll an {@classFeature Endurance Dice|Warden|KT-CLL|2|KT-CLL|Endurance Die}, you can also add the die to the next damage roll or Strength (Athletics) check you make before the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Path of Survival
entries: Starting at 7th level, you gain proficiency in your choice of Constitution or Dexterity saving throws.

subclassFeature.name: Vicious Endurance
entries: Starting at 14th level, your attacks with natural weapons score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20. When you score a critical hit with your natural weapons, you regain 1 expended {@classFeature Endurance Dice|Warden|KT-CLL|2|KT-CLL|Endurance Die}.

subclassFeature.name: Focused Transformation
entries: Additionally at 14th level, while you are concentrating on an innate spell granted by this subclass, your concentration can't be broken as a result of taking damage.

subclassFeature.name: Gigantification
entries: Starting at 17th level, as a bonus action or when you manifest your bestial claws, you can unleash the bestial power within, swelling to massive size. You become Large or Huge (your choice) for 1 minute. Upon transforming, you gain temporary hit points equal to half of your maximum hit points. For the duration of your transformation, you gain the following benefits:

items: {@b Bonus Damage.} Your natural weapons deal an additional die of damage.
{@b Grappling Advantage.} You have advantage on all checks to {@action grapple} creatures smaller than you.
{@b Reach.} Your reach increases by 5 feet with all weapons.
{@b Faster Movement.} Your movement speed increases by 20 feet.
{@b Jumping Distance.} The distance you can long or high jump with a running start is doubled.
{@b Saving Throws.} You have advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws.

{@b Throwing Things.} While in this form, when you make an attack, you can throw Medium or Small objects or creatures you are holding with a range of 50/100 feet. You have proficiency with this attack, regardless of what you are throwing. On hit, both the target and the thrown creature or object takes {@damage 4d6} + your Strength modifier damage. On miss, only the thrown creature or object takes the damage (this damage is taken in place of any falling damage, unless they also fall vertical distance as part of this movement, such as being thrown off a wall or cliff).

entries: Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Bond of the Elderheart
entries: Rooted in the ancient growth of the world, these Wardens are linked to a primordial untamed aspect of the world. Their vines lash and bind, inexorably dragging their enemies to the conclusion of their place in the natural cycle of life and death.

subclassFeature.name: Lashing Vine
entries: Starting at 1st level, when you roll initiative, or as a bonus action at any time, you can manifest lashing vines to wield as natural weapons. You can manifest them in one or both hands. The vines last until you dismiss them as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Lashing Vines
entries: A natural one handed melee weapon. Deals {@damage 1d6} slashing damage on hit, and has the Light, Reach, and Special Properties.
Special: This weapon has the following benefits:

items: {@b Grappling Weapon.} When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can attempt to initiate a {@action grapple} against that creature as a bonus action. If you are grappling a creature with it, you can only use it to attack the creature it is grappling.

{@b Restraining Vines.} You can make a grapple check with this weapon targeting a Large or smaller creature you are currently grappling with it. On success, the creature is restrained while grappled this way.

{@b Reaching Grapples.} You can grapple creatures with this weapon with a reach equal to the weapon's reach. If a creature more than 5 feet away from you is grappled or restrained by you with this weapon their movement is not reduced to zero, but they can only move toward you. Once they are within 5 feet of you, their movement speed becomes zero.

{@b Grappling Larger Creatures.} You can attempt to grapple creatures up to two sizes larger than you when initiating a grapple with this weapon, but creatures two sizes larger than you have their movement speed reduced by half, rather than reduced to zero. If they move out of range of your grapple, you can choose to release them, or be pulled along with their movement.

subclassFeature.name: Eyes of Nature
entries: At 1st level, you gain advantage on Nature or Survival checks that involve plants (to identify them, to tell if they are edible, or track things that have passed through them, etc.).

subclassFeature.name: Innate Magic
entries: Additionally when you select this bond, you gain access to several innate magical abilities by channeling the power of your primal connection.

You gain the following spells at the listed levels, and can cast each spell once without components or spell slots. Once you cast the spell in this way, you cannot cast it again until you complete a long rest. Wisdom is your spellcasting modifier for these spells. You can cast a spell again before completing a long rest by spending 1 + the level of the spell Endurance Dice.

subclassFeature.name: Body of Thorns
entries: Starting at 3rd level, when you are hit by a melee attack, the attacker takes piercing damage equal to the damage reduction of Mystic Bulwark.

subclassFeature.name: Spiked Interdiction
entries: Additionally at 3rd level, the difficult terrain caused by your Primal Interdiction becomes overgrown with spiky thorns. Creatures of your choice take 1d4 piercing damage for each 5 feet of travel within your Primal Interdiction. When you move this effect is suspended until the end of your turn.
This damage increases to 2d4 piercing damage at 11th level.

subclassFeature.name: Hardened Core
entries: Starting at 7th level, you gain a +1 bonus to your AC, and any critical hit against you becomes a normal hit.

subclassFeature.name: Primeval Guardian
entries: Starting at 14th level, as a bonus action you can take root, merging with the ground, transforming into a wrathful treant. While rooted, your movement speed is reduced to zero. When you do so, you can choose to grow one size larger (up to a maximum of Large), your reach increases by 5 feet, you are immune to effects that would move you, the prone condition, and have advantage on Strength ability checks and saving throws.
Creatures two sizes larger than you that you are grappling can no longer drag you, meaning they cannot leave your reach without breaking the grapple.
You can end your tree form at any time as an action.

subclassFeature.name: Arboreal Shelter
entries: Additionally at 14th level, you no longer need to be in range of an attack to impose disadvantage on it with Primal Interdiction, as long as the target of the attack is within range of Primal Interdiction.

subclassFeature.name: New Growth
entries: Starting at 17th level, as an action, you can cause a tree to sprout from the ground at a point within 30 feet of you that morphs into a tree-like-clone of you. It copies all of your statistics and abilities, besides any that recharge on long rest (such as this one) which it does not have access to, and is under your control, but has its own actions and acts immediately after you in initiative.

It has hit points equal to half your maximum hit points. It is in your Primeval Guardian form, and cannot end the effect of that ability. It lasts for 1 minute, or until it is reduced to 0 hit points. If you die while it exists, you become the clone, after which you can end the Primeval Guardian as normal.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Bond of the Stoneblood
entries: The enduring blood of the world flows through you, empowering you with inhuman durability, and mastery over the powers of stone and earth. Empowered with unbreakable resilience and steps that cause the very ground to tremble.

subclassFeature.name: Stone Fists
entries: Starting at 1st level, when you roll initiative or as a bonus action at any time, you can transform one or both arms into durable forms of living stone. You cannot wield weapons or shields in hands that you have turned to stone, but they can be used to {@action grapple} creatures.
While you are grappling a creature with your stone fists, that fist can only attack that creature. The stone fists last until you dismiss them as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Stone Fist
entries: A hardened limb of stone. This becomes a natural one handed melee weapon that deals {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage on hit, and has the Light and Special properties.
Special: You gain +1 to your AC while wielding one of these weapons in each hand (two or more of these if you have more than 2 hands, you cannot benefit from this bonus and the bonus AC of a shield).

subclassFeature.name: Empowered Earth
entries: At 1st level, you gain the {@spell manipulate earth|SpellsThatDontSuck} and {@spell stone forming|KT-CLL} cantrips. When you use {@spell stone forming|KT-CLL}, you can meld any one handed weapon created with it with your {@subclassFeature Stone Fists|Warden|KT-CLL|Stoneblood|KT-CLL|1|KT-CLL}, giving you proficiency in that weapon and replacing Stone Fist's properties (including Special property) with the created weapon's damage dice, damage type, and any properties (beside thrown).

subclassFeature.name: Innate Magic
entries: Additionally when you select this bond, you gain access to several innate magical abilities by channeling the power of your primal connection.

You gain the following spells at the listed levels, and can cast each spell once without components or spell slots. Once you cast the spell in this way, you cannot cast it again until you complete a long rest. Wisdom is your spellcasting modifier for these spells. You can cast a spell again before completing a long rest by spending 1 + the level of the spell Endurance Dice.

subclassFeature.name: Seismic Backlash
entries: Starting at 3rd level, each time you expend an {@classFeature Endurance Dice|Warden|KT-CLL|2|KT-CLL|Endurance Die}, you store the die in a special pool of charged power for 1 minute. You can have a number of charges stored equal to your proficiency bonus. As a bonus action on your turn, you can unleash all of this stored power in an explosive tremor, rolling all the stored dice and expending them from the pool.

All creatures of your choice within the radius of your Primal Interdiction feature must make a Strength saving throw with a DC of 8 + your Strength or Wisdom modifier (your choice) + your Proficiency bonus. On a failed save, they take damage equal to the amount rolled and fall prone. On a successful save, they take half as much damage and do not fall prone.

subclassFeature.name: Gravitational Pull
entries: Additionally at 3rd level, when you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with a surge of gravitational force. A Large or smaller creature of your choice within 60 feet of you must make a Strength saving throw with a DC of 8 + your Strength or Wisdom modifier (your choice) + your proficiency bonus. On a failure, they are pulled up to 15 feet toward you or knocked prone (your choice). The distance they are pulled toward is doubled if the target creature is flying.

subclassFeature.name: Resilient Bulwark
entries: Starting at 7th level, the damage reduction of your Mystic Bulwark is increased by 1.
Additionally, you have resistance to damage from effects that cause you to bleed.

subclassFeature.name: World Breaker
entries: Starting at 14th level, you can cast {@spell fissure|KT-CLL} without expending a spell slot. Once you do so, you cannot do so again until you complete a long rest.

You can use it again early by expending 5 or more charges of Seismic Backlash, casting {@spell fissure|KT-CLL} in place of unleashing the normal effect. Spending additional charges increases the level of it is cast by 1 level per additional charge spent.

subclassFeature.name: Stone Sense
entries: Additionally at 14th level, you gain tremorsense with a range equal to your Primal Interdiction.

subclassFeature.name: Primordial Avatar
entries: Starting at 17th level, as an action you can draw on the strength of the world beneath your feet to become an embodiment of its power for 1 minute. If you start your turn in contact with the ground you gain the following benefits:

items: {@b Strength Advantage.} You have advantage on Strength checks and saving throws.
{@b Endless Vitality.} You regain hit points equal to half your Warden level (rounded down).
{@b Call of the Earth.} Creatures lose their flying speed in range of your {@subclassFeature Primal Interdiction|Warden|KT-CLL|Stoneblood|KT-CLL|14|KT-CLL}.

{@b Reflective Carapace.} If you are targeted by a magic missile, a line spell, or a spell that requires a ranged attack roll, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 4-5 you are unaffected. On a 6, you are unaffected and the effect is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from you, turning the cast into the target.
{@b Empowered Backlash.} You add a bonus die to your {@subclassFeature Seismic Backlash|Warden|KT-CLL|Stoneblood|KT-CLL|3|KT-CLL} pool.

entries: Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Bond of the Sunwatcher
entries: Drawing power from the highest primal authority, you embody the radiance of the sun. The sun burns away all that lurks in the darkness, while bringing the relief of morning light to those that seek it. Ever vigilant, these Wardens weave fire and radiance to destroy their enemies and empower their allies.

subclassFeature.name: Solar Fragment
entries: Starting at 1st level, you can cast the light spell. Wisdom is your spellcasting modifier for it. If you cast light on a {@filter simple melee weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon} you are wielding, the spell lasts as long as the weapon remains in your possession, and the weapon deals fire or radiant damage (your choice) instead of its normal damage type. The damage of a weapon under this effect is increased by Warden abilities that increase the damage of your natural weapons.

subclassFeature.name: Radiant Blast
entries: At 1st level, you gain the ability to gather and release fiery radiant power from your hands or a weapon you are wielding. Radiant Blasts are a ranged natural weapon attack with a normal range of 60 feet, and a long range of 120 feet, that deal 1d6 fire or radiant damage (your choice). If the damage die increases to 1d8 (through Warden features that increase the damage of your natural weapons), the damage becomes 1d4 fire damage and 1d4 radiant damage. You choose which damage type to add your modifier to when you deal damage. You can use your Strength or Wisdom (your choice) in place of your Dexterity for the attack and damage rolls of this ability.

subclassFeature.name: Innate Magic
entries: Additionally when you select this bond, you gain access to several innate magical abilities by channeling the power of your primal connection.

You gain the following spells at the listed levels, and can cast each spell once without components or spell slots. Once you cast the spell in this way, you cannot cast it again until you complete a long rest. Wisdom is your spellcasting modifier for these spells. You can cast a spell again before completing a long rest by spending 1 + the level of the spell Endurance Dice.

subclassFeature.name: Solar Flare
entries: At 3rd level, when you expend an {@classFeature Endurance Dice|Warden|KT-CLL|2|KT-CLL|Endurance Die} to block damage, you can cause a brilliant flare of blinding light. The attacker must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus, or become blinded until the start of their next turn. Pass or fail, if the target is invisible, it is revealed until the start of their next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Radiant Aura
entries: Additionally at 3rd level, your {@classFeature Primal Interdiction|Warden|KT-CLL|2} is filled with bright light, and it casts dim light for an additional radius equal to the radius of your Primal Interdiction. This light is difficult to quench, and counts as a spell equal to half your Warden level (rounded down) for the purposes of countering magical darkness. You can dim, extinguish, or relight this light at any time, no action required.

Creatures inside your Primal Interdiction remain comfortably warm, ignoring the effects of cold weather, or heat caused by the sun (though other sources of heat may still cause discomfort, such as lava). You and all friendly creatures within range of Primal Interdiction can apply the damage reduction of your Mystic Bulwark to cold and necrotic damage.

subclassFeature.name: Empowering Presence
entries: Starting at 7th level, when you expend an {@classFeature Endurance Dice|Warden|KT-CLL|2|KT-CLL|Endurance Die} to boost a saving throw against a spell, all allies within your Primal Interdiction that make a saving throw against the same spell before the start of your next turn can add the same Endurance Die to their saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: Transcendent Passage
entries: Starting at 14th level, as a bonus action, you can transform into a swirling burst of radiant sunlight, traveling up to 60 feet in a straight line. You can pass through creatures and objects, but are blocked by obstructions that completely block light (such as solid opaque walls). This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

Hostile creatures of your choice in your path must make a Dexterity saving throw against 8 + your Strength or Wisdom modifier (your choice) + your proficiency bonus. On failure, they take 2d6 fire damage, 2d6 radiant damage, and are blinded until the start of your next turn. On a success, they take half as much damage and are not blinded. Allied creatures of your choice in your path gain 4d6 temporary hit points. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Solar Avatar
entries: Starting at 17th level, as a bonus action you can call upon the power of the sun to embody its power for 1 minute. For the duration, you gain the following benefits:

items: {@b Sun Light.} You shed bright light for 60 feet, and dim light for additional 60 feet. The bright light is sunlight.
{@b Harsh Light.} Creatures in the bright light you shed have disadvantage on saving throws against your Warden abilities and spells.

{@b Empowered Radiance.} When you make a Radiant Blast, you can shoot a beam of energy instead of an attack, forcing all creatures in a 60 foot line to make a Dexterity saving throw against 8 + your Strength or Wisdom modifier (your choice) + your proficiency bonus, taking damage equal to your Radiant Blast damage on failure, or half as much on a success.

{@b Lingering Light.} When you deal radiant damage against a target, you imbue the target with a radiant illumination, granting advantage to the next attack made against that target before the start of your next turn.

entries: Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Bond of the Ironbound
entries: Ironbound Wardens assert that all that comes of earth is born of primal power, embracing forged metal. Often drawn from mining communities, blacksmiths, or otherwise those with deep understanding and appreciation of the fusion of nature and civilization that forged metal represents, they take full advantage of its power to become invincible edifices of iron.

subclassFeature.name: Ironmonger
entries: Starting at 1st level you gain proficiency in heavy armor and martial melee weapons. Your Mystical Bulwark functions even when using heavy armor, though if you gain additional sources of passive damage reduction, additional sources beyond the highest value only increase the damage reduction by one for each additional source of passive damage reduction.

subclassFeature.name: Armor Bond
entries: At 1st level, as an action, you can touch a set of metal armor worn by a creature of your choice (including yourself) and fortify it. The creature gains temporary hit points equal to 1d8 + your Warden level. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest. Any temporary hit points remaining from this feature fade when you use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Innate Magic
entries: Additionally when you select this bond, you gain access to several innate magical abilities by channeling the power of your primal connection.

You gain the following spells at the listed levels, and can cast each spell once without components or spell slots. Once you cast the spell in this way, you cannot cast it again until you complete a long rest. Wisdom is your spellcasting modifier for these spells. You can cast a spell again before completing a long rest by spending 1 + the level of the spell Endurance Dice.

subclassFeature.name: Unbreakable Endurance
entries: At 3rd level, when you use an Endurance Die to block damage, if it does not completely block the damage taken, you gain resistance to the remaining damage.

subclassFeature.name: Binding Interdiction
entries: Additionally at 3rd level, you gain the ability to manifest chains within the range of your Primal Interdiction.

As a reaction to a creature attempting to leave your Primal Interdiction or as an attack as part of the {@action Attack} action, you can manifest a chain and attempt to bind a Large or smaller creature with it, making a {@action grapple} check against the target. On a success, they are {@condition grappled} by the chain until they escape (contesting your grapple check), the chain is destroyed, or they are no longer within your primal interdiction.

The chain can be destroyed. It has an AC of 18 and number of hit points equal to your Warden level, but you take no damage when the chain is destroyed. If a target escapes the chains, the chains fall to the ground and turn to dust.

You can manifest one chain at a time. If you manifest an additional chain while you already have your maximum number of chains manifested, the first created one vanishes, releasing the target. The number of chains you can manifest this way increases by one each time you gain an effect that would increase the damage die of your Warden natural weapons (such as Evolving Power or Savage Weapons). Once you can manifest more than one chain, you can target the same creature with multiple chains. A creature is restrained while grappled by more than one chain.

subclassFeature.name: Iron Carapace
entries: Starting at 7th level, you can use your power to morph and adapt heavy armor you are wearing. As an action, you can reconfigure your armor, selecting one of the following options.

items: {@b Reinforced Carapace.} Your AC while wearing heavy armor increases by 1.

{@b Regenerating Carapace.} At the end of each of your turns, you restore any damage it has taken, restoring its original AC value. Any pieces that have been removed before regeneration rust away to nothing. If you are wearing no armor, you can use this feature to create a set of mundane heavy armor of your choice (which is automatically equipped). Armor created this way rusts away to nothing when removed.

{@b Spiked Carapace.} When a creature hits you with a melee weapon attack while within 5 feet of you or attempts to {@action grapple} you, they take {@damage 1d4} piercing damage. The damage increases to {@damage 2d4} when you reach 14th level.

entries: The effect lasts until you select another effect, or end the effect as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Iron Incarceration
entries: Starting at 14th level, as bonus action, you can force all Large or smaller creatures of your choice within range of your {@classFeature Primal Interdiction|Warden|KT-CLL|2} to make a Dexterity saving throw against 8 + your Strength or Wisdom modifier (your choice) + your Proficiency bonus. On failure, they are grappled by chains as per your {@subclassFeature Binding Interdiction|Warden|KT-CLL|Ironbound|KT-CLL|3|KT-CLL} feature. Chains created by this feature do not count against your maximum number of chains. You can choose to pull creatures that fail their saving throw to the closest available space to you when they fail their save.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Metallic Monolith
entries: Starting at 17th level, as an action you can empower yourself for 1 minute. You gain the following benefits:

items: {@b Enlarged Weapons.} Metal weapons you are carrying grow larger and more powerful, increasing their damage by {@damage 1d8} while you wield them.

{@b Unlimited Chains.} You can generate an unlimited number of chains with {@subclassFeature Binding Interdiction|Warden|KT-CLL|Ironbound|KT-CLL|3|KT-CLL}, and they no longer have any size limit on what they can restrain.
{@b Implacable Monolith.} You are immune to any effect that would move you against your will or knock you prone.
{@b Damage Resistance.} You gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

entries: Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Bond of the Dreadwing
entries: The Dreadwing Warden utilizes and ancient bond that taps into the deeply rooted primal powers that flow within dragonkind. United with the essence of these legendary beings, they embody the draconic virtues of strength, elemental fury, and fear. These Wardens wield the might and majesty of dragons to dominate the battlefield, leaving all that would oppose them in terrified awe of their power.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Talons
entries: Starting at 1st level, when you roll initiative or as a bonus action at any time, you can manifest one or both of your hands into draconic talons. You cannot wield weapons or shields in hands that you have morphed into talons, but they can be used to {@action grapple} creatures. While you are {@condition grappled|PHB|grappling} a creature with a talon, that talon can only attack that creature. The talons last until you dismiss them as a bonus action.

items: {@b Draconic Talons.} A set of draconic talons extending from one of your hands. This becomes a natural one handed melee weapon that deals {@damage 1d6} slashing damage on hit, and has the Light and Special properties.
{@b Special.} This weapon counts as a free hand for the purposes of grappling. When you successfully initiate a grapple with it, the target takes {@damage 1d6} slashing damage.

subclassFeature.name: Innate Magic
entries: Additionally when you select this bond, you gain access to several innate magical abilities by channeling the power of your primal connection.

You gain the following spells at the listed levels, and can cast each spell once without components or spell slots. Once you cast the spell in this way, you cannot cast it again until you complete a long rest. Wisdom is your spellcasting modifier for these spells. You can cast a spell again before completing a long rest by spending 1 + the level of the spell Endurance Dice.

subclassFeature.name: Dragon's Presence
entries: At 1st level, you learn the draconic language, and gain the ability to channel a fragment of the supernatural dread of dragonkind possess, giving you proficiency in the Intimidation skill.

subclassFeature.name: Intimidating Interdiction
entries: Starting at 3rd level, your {@classFeature Primal Interdiction|Warden|KT-CLL|2} sparks the primordial fear which dragons invoke in lesser creatures. As a bonus action, you can unleash a wave of supernatural dread, forcing all creatures of your choice within range of your Primal Interdiction to make a Wisdom saving throw with a DC of 8 + your Strength or Wisdom modifier (your choice) + your proficiency bonus.

On failure, a creature becomes {@condition Frightened} of you until the start of your next turn. On success, a creature does not become Frightened of you, but cannot gain advantage on attack rolls against you until the start of your next turn. Once a creature passes their saving throw against this ability, they automatically pass all saving throws against it for the next minute.

subclassFeature.name: Dragon Breath
entries: Starting at 3rd level, each time you expend an {@classFeature Endurance Dice|Warden|KT-CLL|2|KT-CLL|Endurance Die} you build up elemental energy, storing the expended die in a special pool of charged power for 1 minute. You can have a number of stored dice equal to your proficiency bonus. As a bonus action on your turn, you can unleash all of this stored power in a blast of elemental breath. You expend all dice stored with this feature when you do so. When you gain this feature, select the elemental type of power stored from acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison.

All creatures of your choice within a 15-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw with a DC of 8 + your Strength or Wisdom modifier (your choice) + your proficiency bonus. On a failed save, they take elemental damage of the type selected equal to the amount rolled on the stored dice. On a successful save, they take half as much damage. The size of the cone increases by 15 feet each time your {@classFeature Primal Interdiction|Warden|KT-CLL|2} range increases by 5 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Dragon Wings
entries: Starting at 7th level, when you manifest your {@subclassFeature Draconic Talons|Warden|KT-CLL|Dreadwing|KT-CLL|1|KT-CLL}, you can further channel your power to manifest a pair of draconic wings. Though they cannot lift you to flight, they provide a host of benefits:

items: You can jump twice as far and change direction mid-jump by beating your wings.
You can slow your descent when falling (no action required), falling at 60 feet per round and taking no damage when you land.
As a reaction, you can expend an endurance die to block damage against a creature within 5 feet of you as if you were blocking damage against yourself.

subclassFeature.name: Empowered Wings
entries: Starting at 14th level, you can use your {@subclassFeature Dragon Wings|Warden|KT-CLL|Dreadwing|KT-CLL|7|KT-CLL} to fly, gaining a flying speed of 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Dragon Form
entries: Starting at 17th level, when you would manifest your {@subclassFeature Draconic Talons|Warden|KT-CLL|Dreadwing|KT-CLL|1|KT-CLL}, you can instead completely turn into a dragon. You gain the benefits of your Draconic Talons and Dragon Wings, but with the following properties:

items: {@b Large Size.} Your size becomes Large, and you gain advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks to grapple creatures smaller than you.
{@b Empowered Dragon Breath.} When you use your {@subclassFeature Dragon Breath|Warden|KT-CLL|Dreadwing|KT-CLL|3|KT-CLL}, you roll twice the number of stored dice for damage.

{@b Extra Natural Weapons.} You gain a Bite and Tail attack, which are natural weapons like your {@subclassFeature Draconic Talons|Warden|KT-CLL|Dreadwing|KT-CLL|1|KT-CLL} and deal the same amount of damage, but change their damage type and replace their special property. The Bite deals piercing damage instead of slashing damage and gains an additional 1d8 elemental damage (matching your {@subclassFeature Dragon Breath|Warden|KT-CLL|Dreadwing|KT-CLL|3|KT-CLL} damage type) in place of the special property, and the Tail deals bludgeoning damage instead of piercing damage and gains the reach property in place of the special property.
{@b Empowered Weapons.} Your natural weapons deal one additional die of damage while transformed this way.

{@b Dragon Dread.} Creatures frightened by your {@subclassFeature Intimidating Interdiction|Warden|KT-CLL|Dreadwing|KT-CLL|3|KT-CLL} become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute instead. Frightened creatures can repeat the saving throw against the frightened condition at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect on success.

entries: You can maintain this form for up to 10 minutes, after which you must return to your normal form. You return to your original form early if you fall unconscious, or you can end the form early as an action. Once you assume this form, you cannot assume it again until you complete a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Bond of the Timetwister
entries: The Timetwister draws upon the enigmatic forces of time, its unstoppable march, and the ebb and flow of the past, present, and future. These Wardens manipulate the battlefield, expedite their allies' actions to a blur while slow their enemies to a crawl. They witness flickers of the past, glimpses of the future, and the ever branching pathways of the present. In battle, a fleeting moment is the only gap between life and death, and these Wardens are the masters of moments.

subclassFeature.name: Time Dilation
entries: Starting at 1st level, you gain the ability to manipulate the flow of time for a creature. As an action, you can accelerate the movement through time for a creature within 60 feet of you, allowing them to move more rapidly. That creature's movement speed is increased by 10 feet, and when they take the {@action Attack} action, they can make a single additional weapon attack as part of the same action until the start of your next turn.

Alternatively, you can decelerate down the movement through time of a creature within 60 feet of you. That creature's speed is reduced by 10 feet and it subtracts a d4 from its attack rolls and Dexterity saving throws until the start of your next turn. When you gain a feature that increases the size of the die for natural weapons you gain from the Warden class, the size of the die increases by one step.
When you reach 5th level in this subclass, you can accelerate or decelerate a creature as an attack as part of attack action, but you can only do each once per turn.

subclassFeature.name: Foreshadowing
