entries: Additionally at 1st level, you can glimpse future possibilities. When you roll initiative, record the result on the {@dice d20}. Within the next minute, you can replace one of your attack rolls, ability checks, or saving throws with the roll.

Alternatively, you can replace one attack roll or contested ability check of an enemy within 5 feet of you with the roll. This range extends to the range of your {@classFeature Primal Interdiction|Warden|KT-CLL|2} when you gain that feature.

entries.name: Contested Ability Checks
entries: A contested ability check is one where two creatures are rolling against each other, such as a {@action Grapple} check. This means you cannot use it to prevent a creature succeeding a check against a spell (such as a Strength ability check to escape Entangle). Note you also cannot use it on enemy saving throws, only your own.

subclassFeature.name: Innate Magic
entries: Additionally when you select this bond, you gain access to several innate magical abilities by channeling the power of your primal connection.

You gain the following spells at the listed levels, and can cast each spell once without components or spell slots. Once you cast the spell in this way, you cannot cast it again until you complete a long rest. Wisdom is your spellcasting modifier for these spells. You can cast a spell again before completing a long rest by spending 1 + the level of the spell Endurance Dice.

subclassFeature.name: Time Distortion
entries: Starting at 3rd level, your {@classFeature Primal Interdiction|Warden|KT-CLL|2} begins to distort time. The difficult terrain created by your Primal Interdiction affects the movement of flying creatures as well, and when you recklessly defend your allies with your Primal Interdiction you can grant them advantage on Dexterity saving throws as well.

subclassFeature.name: Timely Intervention
entries: Additionally at 3rd level, you can expend {@classFeature Endurance Dice|Warden|KT-CLL|2} to further bend time within your {@classFeature Primal Interdiction|Warden|KT-CLL|2}, gaining the following new options for using them:

items: {@b Missed Beat.} As a reaction to a creature within your Primal Interdiction being attacked, you can expend an Endurance Die to slow the creature's reactions, giving the triggering attack against them advantage.

{@b Minor Adjustment.} As a reaction to a creature within your Primal Interdiction being affected by an area of effect, you stop time long enough for them to move up to 5 feet before the effect applies, potentially moving out of the area of effect.

{@b Arrow Time.} As a reaction to a creature within your Primal Interdiction being attacked by a ranged weapon projectile attack, you can stop the projectile in time, rolling the Endurance Die and subtracting the roll from the weapon's attack roll.

subclassFeature.name: Time Zone
entries: Starting at 7th level, as a bonus action you can project your {@classFeature Primal Interdiction|Warden|KT-CLL|2} to be centered on a point within 60 feet instead of you. When you do so, the effects of difficult terrain and your abilities that take place inside your Primal Interdiction cover the area within range of the point rather than you. The aura returns to surrounding you if you move more than 60 feet from the point, or if you return it to you as a bonus action. You cannot recklessly defend your allies with your Primal Interdiction while it is projected at a point that does not also contain you within its radius.

subclassFeature.name: Chrono Controller
entries: Starting at 14th level, your mastery of time becomes more extensive and intuitive. You can no longer lose concentration on spells granted by your {@classFeature Innate Magic|Warden|KT-CLL|Timetwister|KT-CLL|1} feature from this subclass by taking damage, and when you cast them, you can cast them as if they were cast with a spell slot one level higher than their default spell level when they have an applicable effect.

subclassFeature.name: Time Lock
entries: Starting at 17th level, you can cast time stop without expending a spell slot. When you cast time stop, you always stop time for maximum amount of time rather than rolling.
Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Bond of the Astral Guardian
entries: Embarking on a path less traveled, the Astral Guardian Warden transcends the earthly plane and draws from the power of the infinite planes. Touched by the enigmatic forces of space and energy, they embody the mystery of the universe, controlling spatial distortions and manipulating celestial energies.

subclassFeature.name: Astral Arms
entries: Starting at 1st level, you gain the ability to form up to two astral arms as a bonus action. These are natural melee weapons with the Light property which deal {@damage 1d4} force damage on hit. You can additionally use them to {@action grapple} creatures and make unarmed strikes with them. You can use your Wisdom modifier in place of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for attack and damage rolls made with these weapons.

These arms last until you fall unconscious or you dismiss them as a bonus action. The maximum number of arms you can form increases to 4 at 9th level, and 6 at 17th level. The number of arms do not affect the number of attacks you can make, but the arms can be used to grapple creatures.
When you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can make a single unarmed strike or grapple check with one of your Astral Arms as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Sixth Sense
entries: Additionally at 1st level, you gain a special sense allowing you to sense extraplanar energies. You can detect if you are being watched through magic or by creatures within 30 feet of you in the ethereal plane if your passive Perception is equal to or higher than 10 + their CR (or their spell save DC if they are using a spell to observe you).

subclassFeature.name: Innate Magic
entries: Additionally when you select this bond, you gain access to several innate magical abilities by channeling the power of your primal connection.

You gain the following spells at the listed levels, and can cast each spell once without components or spell slots. Once you cast the spell in this way, you cannot cast it again until you complete a long rest. Wisdom is your spellcasting modifier for these spells. You can cast a spell again before completing a long rest by spending 1 + the level of the spell {@classFeature Endurance Dice|Warden|KT-CLL|2}.

subclassFeature.name: Dimensional Interdiction
entries: Starting at 3rd level, the difficult terrain of your {@classFeature Primal Interdiction|Warden|KT-CLL|2} affects flying creatures within range as well. Additionally, any creature that attempts to teleport into or out of the radius of your Primal Interdiction must succeed a Charisma saving throw with a DC equal to 8 + your Wisdom modifier + your proficiency bonus. On a failed save, the teleport is wasted and they are not transported. You can choose to allow a creature to teleport in or out of Primal Interdiction without making a save.

subclassFeature.name: Astral Strike
entries: Additionally at 3rd level When you expend an {@classFeature Endurance Dice|Warden|KT-CLL|2|KT-CLL|Endurance Die}, you can empower your next attack with your {@subclassFeature Astral Arms|Warden|KT-CLL|Astral Guardian|KT-CLL|1|KT-CLL} before the end of your next turn. The attack gains a reach equal to the range of your {@classFeature Primal Interdiction|Warden|KT-CLL|2|KT-CLL}, and if it hits, deals additional damage equal to one of your Endurance Dice.

Additionally, you can force the target to make a Charisma saving throw with a DC of 8 + your Wisdom modifier + your Proficiency bonus. On a failure, you can teleport them to an empty space within range of your Primal Interdiction.

subclassFeature.name: Astral Beacon
entries: Starting at 7th level, as bonus action, you can teleport a willing creature within 60 feet into any empty space within range of your {@classFeature Primal Interdiction|Warden|KT-CLL|2}. You can do this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all uses when you complete a long rest.

Additionally, your Primal Interdiction is always considered as in range of allied creature's teleport abilities, even if it would normally be out of range of the teleport, as long as they are within 300 feet of you.

subclassFeature.name: Dimensional Guardian
entries: Additionally at 7th level, you gain resistance to force damage, and advantage on any saving throw against being teleported or moved between planes against your will.

subclassFeature.name: Astral Rift
entries: Starting at 14th level, as an action, you can open an Astral Rift connecting two places with a tear in reality. One rift appears in an empty space within 5 feet of you of your choice, and the other appears in an empty space at a point you are familiar with within a number of miles equal to your Warden level. The tear takes the shape of a swirling opaque roughly circular portal with a 5 foot radius. A willing creature that passes through it is teleported to an empty space within 5 feet of the other portal
The rift remains open for 1 minute once opened, or until you close it as an action. Once you create an astral rift, you cannot do so again until you complete a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Astral Projection
entries: Starting at 17th level, you can astrally project your soul out of your body as an action. When you do so, your body becomes {@condition stunned} and {@condition incapacitated}, but you can act in your astral form. While in your astral form, you have the following benefits:

items: {@b Astral Form.} Your astral form is resistant to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
{@b Flying Speed.} You gain a flying speed equal to your movement speed, and can hover.

{@b Ethereal.} You can pass through physical objects and creatures as if they are difficult terrain, but cannot end your turn inside another creatures or objects' space, being moved to the last unoccupied space you occupied if you try.

{@b Planar Shift.} You can move between your current plane and the ethereal plane as an action. While on the ethereal plane, you can see and hear the plane you originated from, which is cast in shades of gray, and you can't see anything there more than 60 feet away.

entries: Otherwise, your astral form shares all abilities and statistics with your normal form. While you use this ability, your Primal Interdiction projects from your astral form instead of your body. When you use this ability, you can project yourself to any plane or location you are familiar with. If your astral form is reduced to 0 hit points, you are returned to your body and regain 1 hit point. You can end the project at any time as a bonus action, returning to your body.

subclassFeature.name: Bond of the Bone Binder
entries: Commanding the dark powers of the fallen, a Bone Warden watches over the endless and final silence of the end of life. Solemn and grim, they recycle the remains of life to one final service, binding the bones of once living creatures to form their armor, weapons, and grim constructs to bind and crush those that stand in their way of their primal decrees.

subclassFeature.name: Bone Construct
entries: Starting at 1st level, as an action you can call forth a grim construct of bones that bursts from the ground in an empty space within 10 feet of you. It has the following stat block. It shares your turn, but cannot take any actions unless you use your action to direct it to take the {@action Dodge} action, {@action Dash} action, or take an action listed in its stat block. In addition to the actions in a stat block, it can follow simple instructions and perform simple tasks out of combat, but cannot communicate or execute complicated directions on its own. If you give it no directions, it stands still or follows you if you are more than 30 feet from it. When you gain the Extra {@action Attack} feature, you can replace one attack you can make with directing your {@creature Bone Construct|KT-CLL|Bone Construct} to take an action.
Its Strength (indicated in its stat block as a *) is equal to your Strength or Wisdom ability score (your choice).

If it is more than 120 feet from you or reduced to zero hit points, it crumbles to dust. You can dismiss your Construct at any time as a bonus action, causing crumble to dust and await your call again.

Your Bone Construct's hit points are maintained between summons, but if it has less than your Warden level in hit points (such as if it was previously destroyed by being reduced to 0 hit points), it gains hit points equal to your Warden level when you spend your action calling it, and regains all of its hit points when you complete a long rest.
Your Bone Constructs Slam damage die is increased in size by any effect that increases the size of your natural weapon damage dice.

subclassFeature.name: Macabre Mantle
entries: At 1st level, if your armor becomes damaged, you can repair it using the bones of a medium or larger creature's corpse (provided it has bones). You can forge entirely new armor this way. Armor forged this way can be any mundane armor with a maximum value of 100 times your Warden level in gold pieces, and can only be used by you.
Additionally, while you are wearing armor created this way or that you've bonded with Mystic Bulwark, you gain proficiency with the Intimidation skill.

subclassFeature.name: Innate Magic
entries: Additionally when you select this bond, you gain access to several innate magical abilities by channeling the power of your primal connection.

You gain the following spells at the listed levels, and can cast each spell once without components or spell slots. Once you cast the spell in this way, you cannot cast it again until you complete a long rest. Wisdom is your spellcasting modifier for these spells. You can cast a spell again before completing a long rest by spending 1 + the level of the spell Endurance Dice.
{@sup } You cannot cast this spell again early using {@classFeature Endurance Dice|Warden|KT-CLL|2}

subclassFeature.name: Bone Emissary
entries: Starting at 3rd level, your {@creature Bone Construct|KT-CLL} gains its own {@classFeature Primal Interdiction|Warden|KT-CLL|2} extending to a range of 5 feet around it. When you recklessly defend your allies within range of your Primal Interdiction, your Bone Construct does the same for any creatures within the range of the Primal Interdiction emitting from it.

subclassFeature.name: Bonded Endurance
entries: Additionally at 3rd level, you can use {@classFeature Endurance Dice|Warden|KT-CLL|2} to reduce damage taken by your {@creature Bone Construct|KT-CLL}. When you do so, you gain temporary hit points equal to the value rolled on the die. When you block damage with an Endurance Die against yourself, your Bone Construct gains temporary hit points equal to value rolled on the die.

subclassFeature.name: Unearthed Titan
entries: Starting at 7th level, your {@creature Bone Construct|KT-CLL} gains the following features:
{@b Large Size.} When you summon it, you can summon it as a Large sized creature.
{@b Immediate Commands.} When you use your action to summon it, you can use your bonus action to command it to take one of its actions.
{@b Magical Attacks.} Its attacks become magical for the purposes of overcoming resistance to nonmagical attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Unliving Resilience
entries: Additionally at 7th level, you gain resistance to one damage type of your choice from cold, necrotic, or poison damage.
Additionally, you gain advantage on saving throws against poison or disease, and you can go twice as long without breathing, eating, and sleeping without suffering negative consequences.

subclassFeature.name: Grave Grip
entries: Starting at 14th level, as an action, you can call for skeletal grasping hands to raise from the ground and bind your foes. All Large or smaller creatures of your choice within range of your {@classFeature Primal Interdiction|Warden|KT-CLL|2} (or the Primal Interdiction of your {@creature Bone Construct|KT-CLL}) must make a Dexterity saving throw with a DC of 8 + your Strength or Wisdom modifier (your choice) + your proficiency bonus.

On failure, the creature becomes {@condition Restrained} by a skeletal hand rising from the earth. The creature can break free as an action by making a Strength saving throw with the same DC as the original save, or can be freed if the skeletal hand is destroyed. It has an AC of 13 and 13 hit points, with a vulnerability to bludgeoning damage.
If a creature ends its turn while {@condition Restrained} by a skeletal hand from this ability, it takes {@damage 3d6} necrotic damage.
Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Death's Domain
entries: Starting at 17th level, as a bonus action you can project your domain around you for 1 minute, with the following effects:

items: {@b Expanded Domain.} The range of your {@classFeature Primal Interdiction|Warden|KT-CLL|2} is doubled.

{@b Spare the Dying.} If an allied creature falls to 0 hit points within range of your Primal Interdiction, you can cast spare the dying on them as a reaction (without needing to be able to touch them).

{@b Boneyard.} Skeletal constructs you create (including your {@creature Bone Construct|KT-CLL}, skeletal hands from {@subclassFeature Grave Grip|Warden|KT-CLL|Bone Binder|KT-CLL|14|KT-CLL}, objects created by spells such as {@spell ribcage|KT-CLL}, or skeletons created by spells such as {@spell animate dead|PHB}) gain resistance to all damage while within range of your Primal Interdiction.

entries: Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Commander's Presence
entries: A Commander on the field can be many things—a trusted sergeant, a weary veteran, or merely a person with an uncommon degree of common sense and a particularly keen eye for how to win a fight.

While not as flashy as some of the other Presences on the Battlefield, that just means they are less likely to get themselves skewered. A keen word there and helping hand here, their influence is subtle but effective, inexorably shifting the tides of battle in their favor.
A Commander can come from any background, but is usually someone that has acquired their Wisdom the hard way, having seen a bit of what life and battlefields have to offer.

subclassFeature.name: Martial Proficiency
entries: Starting at 1st level when you take this Presence, you gain proficiency in heavy armor, shields, and martial weapons.

subclassFeature.name: Form Up!
entries: Starting at 1st level, when you roll initiative and are not surprised, any number of friendly creatures within 30 feet of you can move up to their speed a number of feet equal to five times your Wisdom modifier (minimum 5 feet).

entries.name: Sequential Movement at the Same Time.
entries: D&D is typically a turn-based game, and thus people do not typically move at the same time; an ability that allows multiple creatures to move at the same time opens the door to questions about order. This ability represents the Commander's Presence causing their companions to spring into a well oiled routine, and it is recommended that you let the players move in their desired order during this movement.
It should also be noted that this movement is determined by the player moving. A Warlord grants their allies the ability to move, they do not necessarily move them.

subclassFeature.name: Keen Pointer
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can take the Helpful Word bonus action without expending a Leadership Die if you are within 5 feet of the creature you are taking the {@action Help} action against.
When you do so, you can expend Leadership Dice to apply Rallying Mark to the creature you are targeting with this Help action.

subclassFeature.name: On Your Feet!
entries: Starting at 7th level, you can use a bonus action and expend one Leadership Die to restore the will to fight in an allied creature. Choose a friendly creature within 5 feet of you. That creature regains hit points equal to your Leadership die.

When you use this feature to restore hit points to a creature at 0 hit points, you can add your Wisdom modifier to the amount of hit points restored. If the creature is prone, it can choose to stand immediately.

subclassFeature.name: Martial Advantage
entries: Starting at 11th level, you've learned to leverage fighting alongside an ally. Once per turn, you can deal an extra {@damage 2d6} damage to a creature you hit with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 feet of one of your allies that isn't incapacitated.

subclassFeature.name: Bulwark
entries: Starting at 15th level, when you and any number of friendly creatures within 30 feet of you make a Saving Throw against the same effect, your allies gain Advantage on their Saving Throw if you succeed on the saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: No One Left Behind!
entries: Starting at 18th level, you can move up to your speed to get within 5 feet of a creature while using your On Your Feet feature. During this movement you gain resistance to all damage and the target regains an additional {@damage 1d8} hit points for each attack of opportunity made against you during this movement.

subclassFeature.name: Chieftain's Presence
entries: A chieftain is a Warlord that rules by the sheer force of their personality, marked by their booming voice and fearless attitude, it is easy to believe that your band is infallible while your chieftain stands.

They can be lawful or chaotic, good or evil, with such things depending on how they got to where they are in life. An orc that cut their way to the top may be chaotic, believing that strength needs room to rise to the top unfettered by rules, while someone that inherited their authority may have a more lawful bent.

A Warlord with the Presence of a Chieftain need not literally rule anything, but is an exemplar of someone that has or could walk that path through their force of personality and the boisterous inspiration they give those around them.

subclassFeature.name: Chieftain's Proficiency
entries: Starting at 1st level when you take this Presence, you gain proficiency in shields, martial weapons, and the {@skill Intimidation} skill, or another skill of your choice if you are already proficient.

subclassFeature.name: Wolfpack Rush
entries: Starting at 1st level, the first time an allied creature moves after rolling initiative, it can bring a number of willing creatures equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum 1) within 20 feet of you along with it in the same distance and direction that they move, but cannot move more than half of their movement speed and cannot move more than 20 feet from you. Creatures can stop this movement at any point along the path.

subclassFeature.name: Warcry
entries: Starting at 3rd level, as an action or in place of an attack as part of the {@action Attack} action, you can expend a number of {@classFeature Leadership Dice|Warlord|KT-CLL|2} (up to your per turn limit) to inspire your allies with a mighty Warcry. You and friendly creatures within 20 feet of you gain temporary hit points equal to the Leadership Dice roll + your Charisma modifier (minimum 1). This can affect a number of creatures up to your 1 + Charisma modifier (minimum 1).
You can make a single weapon attack as a bonus action after unleashing a War Cry, but the attack roll has disadvantage unless made with a weapon with light property.

subclassFeature.name: Savage Momentum
entries: Additionally at 3rd level, whenever you spend a {@classFeature Leadership Dice|Warlord|KT-CLL|2|KT-CLL|Leadership Die}, you gain advantage on the next attack roll you make before the end of your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Reckless Assault
entries: Starting at 7th level, when a creature with temporary hit points from one of your abilities deals damage, they can expend those temporary hit points to add damage equal to half the temporary hit points sacrificed to their damage dealt.

subclassFeature.name: Wolfpack Tactics
entries: Starting at 11th level, you excel at taking down prey in coordination with your allies. The first creature you hit that has taken damage from one of your allies since the end of your last turn suffers an additional {@damage 1d12} damage.

The first time a creature you grant a creature an attack with {@classFeature Battlefield Presence|Warlord|KT-CLL|1} deals damage to a creature you had dealt damage to during your turn, that attack deals an additional {@damage 1d4} damage.

subclassFeature.name: Booming Shout
entries: Starting at 15th level, when you unleash your {@subclassFeature Warcry|Warlord|KT-CLL|Chieftain|KT-CLL|3|KT-CLL} you can attempt to frighten enemies. Any number of creatures of your choice within range of your Warcry must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC of 8 + Charisma modifier + your proficiency bonus) or become {@condition frightened} of you until the end of their turn. Once you have used Booming Shout, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.
Additionally, the range of your {@classFeature Leadership Dice|Warlord|KT-CCL|2|KT-CLL|Rallying Mark}, Urgent Orders, Helpful Word, and Warcry is doubled.

subclassFeature.name: Bloody Victory
entries: Starting at 18th level, when you or an ally reduces a hostile creature that has dealt damage to you to 0 hit points, you can unleash a {@subclassFeature Warcry|Warlord|KT-CLL|Chieftain|KT-CLL|3|KT-CLL} as a reaction. When you unleash your Warcry in this way, you do not expend any {@classFeature Leadership Dice|Warlord|KT-CLL|2|KT-CLL} and you use a {@dice d12} in place of your Leadership Die.
You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier, regaining all uses on a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Noble's Presence
entries: A Warlord with a Noble Presence is not inherently one that was born a Noble, though many are. A Noble Presence Warlord is one that serves to drive their retainers and companions onto greater heights through sheer charisma, a shining beacon of what they are fighting for standing beside them.

Since time immemorial men have fought twice as hard on a battlefield when their leader takes the field to stand among them, driven to heights that would seem impossible in order to protect their liege—while an adventurer of this path may or may not be their liege, their charisma invokes the same fervor in their companions and retainers.

An adventurer on this path is not inherently of noble background, though many often are. A noble reared on the laws of the land is usually lawful, but extraordinary circumstances may have brought about a rebellious streak in one that now seeks to overthrow unfit rulers (or rulers that aren't them, anyway).

subclassFeature.name: Destined Leader
entries: Starting at 1st level when you take this Presence you gain proficiency with rapiers, longswords and the {@skill Persuasion} skill, or another skill of your choice if you are already proficient. Additionally, you gain an additional {@classFeature Leadership Dice|Warlord|KT-CLL|2|KT-CLL|Leadership Die} at 3rd level, 9th level, and 15th level.

subclassFeature.name: Call to Arms
entries: Starting at 1st level, when you roll initiative you can call out to friendly creatures within 60 feet of you, providing them with a surge of inspiration. Creatures of your choice equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum 1) gain advantage on their first attack roll.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Leader
entries: Additionally at 1st level, an allied creature with a CR of less than half your Warlord level (or with fewer class levels than you have Warlord levels if the creature does not have a CR) can choose to use your proficiency bonus + Charisma modifier for the attack roll modifier on the first {@action Attack} they make in a turn where they have been granted by {@classFeature Battlefield Presence|Warlord|KT-CLL|1}.

entries.name: Retainers & Followers
entries: A Noble Warlord gets more mileage out of their retainers or followers than other Warlords, but in turn is more dependent on having someone else make their attacks for them.
This does not inherently mean they need NPC followers, however. A loyal retainer is always a good idea, but it can be a friendly Fighter just as easily as an NPC follower.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Right
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can use {@classFeature Leadership Dice|Warlord|KT-CLL|2} (up to your per turn limit) to cast {@spell command|PHB}. The level of the spell is equal to the number of Leadership Dice spent.
The spell save DC for these spells are 8 + your Charisma modifier + your Proficiency bonus.
You can also add your Charisma (maximum 2) to your AC so long as you are not wearing heavy armor or using a shield.

subclassFeature.name: Charismatic Leadership
entries: Additionally at 3rd level, you can add your Charisma modifier to the damage bonus of {@classFeature Leadership Dice|Warlord|KT-CLL|2|KT-CLL|Rallying Mark}, the temporary hit points granted by Urgent Orders, and the attack roll of a creature that gains advantage from Helpful Word.

subclassFeature.name: Words of Conviction
entries: Starting at 7th level, you can use {@classFeature Leadership Dice|Warlord|KT-CLL|2} (Up to your per turn limit) to cast {@spell bless|PHB} or {@spell heroism|PHB} without providing material components. The level of the spell is equal to the number of Leadership Dice spent.

subclassFeature.name: Imperative Order
entries: Starting at 7th level, when you spend 2 or more {@classFeature Leadership Dice|Warlord|KT-CLL|2} on a target with Urgent Orders, you can allow the target creature to make a single weapon attack with their reaction instead of moving. If you spend 3 or more Leadership Dice on a target, the target creature can both move and make a single weapon attack with their reaction.

subclassFeature.name: Inspired Zeal
entries: Starting at 11th level, all creatures of your choice within 30 feet of you deal an extra {@damage 1d4} radiant damage when they hit with a weapon attack.

subclassFeature.name: Untouchable Presence
entries: Starting at 15th level, you are under the effect of {@spell sanctuary|PHB} spell. This effect ends as normal if you take an action that would break it, but returns at the start of your next turn.
The spell save DC for this spell is 8 + your Charisma modifier + your Proficiency bonus.

subclassFeature.name: Grand Decree
entries: Starting at 18th level, you can use this ability to cast {@spell command|PHB} without expending a spell slot or {@classFeature Leadership Dice|Warlord|KT-CLL|2}. When you do so, the spell affects all creatures of your choice within range that could be affected by the spell.
Once you cast command using this ability, you cannot cast it using this ability again until you complete a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Packleader's Presence
entries: While Warlords may specialize in the control of battles, an Packleader is a Warlord that aims to win a fight before it becomes a battle. Through scouting, preparing, and stacking the odds, they don't fight fair, they fight to win, and seek to only fight when they've already won.

Their control of the battlefield doesn't merely extend to those that fight on it, but to twisting the battlefield itself to suit their needs, stymieing and stupefying their foes while concealing and sheltering their allies with the terrain itself.

While good and evil rarely play directly into a Packleader's perspective (they can be either or Neutral just as easily), they tend be Chaotic, viewing the so called "rules of engagement" and other traditions of civilization to be convenient weaknesses they can exploit rather than any sort of guideline they might actually follow.

subclassFeature.name: Tools of the Wild
entries: Starting at 1st level when you take this Presence, you gain proficiency in martial weapons, the {@skill Survival} skill, or another skill of your choice if already proficient, and your choice of the {@item Herbalism Kit|PHB} or the {@item Poisoner's Kit|PHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Concealed Approach
entries: Starting at 1st level, if you have at least a minute to prepare, you can add your Wisdom modifier to a Dexterity (Stealth) check for you and up five friendly creatures. You and friendly creatures within 30 feet of you that roll for initiative while hidden can add your Wisdom modifier to the initiative result.

subclassFeature.name: Nature's Gift
entries: Starting at 3rd level, through your connection to the wild battlefields you've mastered offers you some measure of control of them. You learn the spell {@spell mold earth|PHB}, and can pick one additional cantrip from the Druid list that you know.

Additionally, you can expend one Leadership Die to cast {@spell fog cloud|PHB} or {@spell snare|XGE} as 1st level spells. The casting time of snare is one action when you cast it this way. You can pick one additional 1st level spell from the Druid spell list with a casting time of one action to cast this way.
Your spell casting modifier for these spells is Wisdom, and your spell Save DC for these spells is 8 + your Proficiency bonus + your Wisdom Modifier.

entries.name: A Pack Leader's Pack
entries: Many Packleaders opt to pick {@spell animal friendship|PHB} or {@spell speak with animals|PHB} in order to establish animal allies to expand their pack, but just as many don't feel the need to be required to have an animal companion.

subclassFeature.name: Shroud of Nature
entries: Starting at 7th level, you and your allies can fade away behind natural shrouds. Whenever you cast a spell that results in you or a friendly creature becoming obscured (such as being within the radius of a {@spell fog cloud|PHB} or behind earth moved by {@spell mold earth|XGE}), the obscured creature can use their reaction to take the {@action Hide} action.

subclassFeature.name: Trackless Trails
entries: Additionally at 7th level, you can spend 2 {@classFeature Leadership Dice|Warlord|KT-CLL|2} to cast {@spell pass without trace|PHB} without providing material components.

subclassFeature.name: Fleeting Strikers
entries: Starting at 11th level, if you are not in the same spot you were at the end of your last turn or are obscured from your target, the first attack you make during your turn deals an additional {@damage 1d10} damage.
Additionally, a creature that you grant an {@action Attack} with Battlefield Presence can take the {@action Dash} action instead of making the attack you granted.

subclassFeature.name: Ghosts of the Wild
entries: Starting at 15th level, while under the effect of {@spell pass without trace|PHB}, you can expend one Leadership Die to take the {@action Hide} action at the end of your turn without expending an action.

If you use Battlefield Presence to grant an attack to a creature, you can expend one Leadership Die to shroud them with shadows or natural phenomena, granting them advantage on the first attack they make before the start of your next turn. If they are under the effect of {@spell pass without trace|PHB}, you can do this without expending a Leadership Die.

subclassFeature.name: Warlord of the Wilds
entries: Starting at 18th level, you can pick five additional spells from the {@filter Druid spell list|spells|level=0;1;2;3;4|class=druid} of 4th level or lower . You can cast these spells using {@classFeature Leadership Dice|Warlord|KT-CLL|2} equal to the level of the spell. You can change the list of spells you have selected when you complete a long rest. The spell Save DC for these spells is 8 + your Proficiency bonus + your Wisdom Modifier.
Any time you use Leadership Dice to cast a spell, you can take the {@action Attack} action (one weapon attack only) as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Paragon's Presence
entries: Legends tell of warriors that fight at the front of a legion, of the valor they display and the inspiration it gives their comrades. A Paragon before their army is a dauntless foe, and an army behind their Paragon is an unstoppable legion.
A Paragon is not inherently good or evil. An evil legion can be led by a bold and charismatic Warlord just as effectively as the forces of good.
As they tend to be those that inspire an organized force, more often than not they will be lawful, but what that personal code of laws entails can vary quite widely.

subclassFeature.name: Martial Proficiency
entries: Starting at 1st level when you take this Presence, you gain proficiency in heavy armor, shields, and martial weapons.

subclassFeature.name: Lead the Charge
entries: Starting at 1st level, you can give yourself a bonus to your initiative rolls equal to your Charisma modifier. Additionally, when you roll initiative you gain temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier + your proficiency bonus.

subclassFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options. You can't take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again:

items: {@bold Defense:} While you are wearing armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC.
{@bold Dueling:} When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.

{@bold Great Weapon Fighting:} When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a melee weapon that you are wielding with two hands, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2. The weapon must have the two-handed or versatile property for you to gain this benefit.
{@bold Two-Weapon Fighting:} When you engage in two-weapon fighting, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack.

subclassFeature.name: Heroic Strike
entries: Additionally at 3rd level, when you take the {@action Attack} action, once per turn you can expend {@classFeature Leadership Dice|Warlord|KT-CLL|2} (up to your per turn limit) to apply Rallying Mark as part of a melee weapon attack.
Whenever you expend Leadership Dice as part of making an attack, you can add the expended Leadership Dice to the damage roll of the attack.

subclassFeature.name: Stand Defiant
entries: Starting at 7th level, when you are reduced to zero hit points, you instantly regain a number of hit points equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum 1). Additionally, you can expend a number of {@classFeature Leadership Dice|Warlord|KT-CLL|2} equal to the number of friendly creatures within 60 feet of you, regaining additional hit points equal to the value rolled this way. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Inspired Warrior
entries: Starting at 11th level, once per turn, when one of your allies within 30 feet takes or deals damage, you gain {@dice d4} dice, adding it to a pool of dice. You can have a maximum number of {@dice d4} dice in this pool equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum 1).
Until the end of your next turn, when you deal damage you can expend any number of dice from this pool rolling them and dealing additional damage equal to the value rolled.

entries.name: The Prowess of the Inspired
entries: Effectively in almost all cases, what this ability boils down to is that if their companions are fighting around them within 30 feet, the Paragon will add a number of {@dice d4} equal to their Charisma modifier to the first attack on their turn.
The ability can be simplified to that, but that will result in it being slightly stronger than anticipated if the Paragon moves first or has few companions at their side.

subclassFeature.name: Dauntless Resolve
entries: Starting at 15th level, when you fail a saving throw, you can choose to succeed instead. Once you do this, you cannot do this again until you complete a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Invincible Legion
entries: Starting at 18th level, your allies will never fall so long as their symbol of hope remains. When a friendly creature within 60 feet of you is reduced to 0 hit points, but not killed outright, they can drop to 1 hit point instead so long as they can see or hear you.
Once a creature benefits from this effect, they cannot benefit from it again until they complete a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Tactician's Presence
entries: A Tactician may very well tell you they would just as soon not be close enough to the battle to be considered a combatant, preferring to win their fights before they even reach that stage, but one would be a fool to underestimate how dangerous they are once on the battlefield.

While they might have laid their plans in advance, their sharp minds can quickly pick apart how their foes try to fight against them and effortlessly pierce the crude tactics that would be used against them and their allies.

What tends to mark a Tactician is a keen mind and a willingness to plan ahead... in great detail. Adventurers with a tactician among them are near impossible to pin down, as they will always find a way to turn the tables.

subclassFeature.name: Tactician's Cunning
entries: When you take this Presence at 1st level, you gain proficiency in the {@skill History} and {@skill Investigation} skills, or other skills of your choice if you are already proficient. Additionally, if you can take a minute or more making any ability check with a skill you are proficient in, you can treat a d20 roll of 4 or lower as a 5.

subclassFeature.name: Battle Plans
entries: Starting at 1st level, you can give yourself a bonus to your initiative rolls equal to your Intelligence modifier. Additionally, you can exchange that initiative roll with a willing friendly creature within 60 feet after rolling it.

subclassFeature.name: Tactical Insight
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can tactically assess a creature's options. As a bonus action, make an Intelligence (Investigation) check contested by a Charisma (Deception) check against any creature you can see within 60 feet. On a success, you can see through their tactics, granting one of the following effects:

items: {@bold Determine Attack:} You can cause them to have disadvantage on their next attack against a creature that can see or hear you.

{@bold Predict Movement:} You deduce where they are planning to move on their next turn. They can choose to change their plans, but if they move anywhere else, their movement speed is reduced by 10 feet as they scramble to adapt.
{@bold Outwit Response:} You can find their openings, negating their ability to use their reaction until the end of their next turn.
{@bold Expose Weakness:} You can use Helpful Word to grant advantage against that target as part of the bonus action without expending a Leadership Die.

entries.name: Planning Movement... or not.
entries: A DM can choose to read the second bullet point of Tactical insight as simply reducing the targets movement by 10. It is balanced around this assumption, predicting the movement is optional flavor, but may not fit all DMs' styles.

subclassFeature.name: Tactical Flexibility
entries: Additionally at 3rd level, you gain the ability to use Tactical Insight, Rallying Mark, Helpful Word, and Urgent Orders as an action or a bonus action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Inscrutable Mind
entries: Starting at 7th level, you gain proficiency in Intelligence Saving Throws.
Additionally, as a reaction when being forced to make a Wisdom, Intelligence, or Charisma Saving Throw, you can expend one Leadership Die and add the die result to the saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: Control the Field
entries: Starting at 7th level, when you use an ability that moves allied creatures (such as {@classFeature Leadership Dice|Warlord|KT-CLL|2|KT-CLL|Urgent Orders} or {@classFeature Shift the Field|Warlord|KT-CLL|14}), it gains the following properties:

items: {@bold Deceptive Movement:} You can attempt to move creatures that are not allies up to 5 feet (or half their movement speed, whichever is less). The creature must make an Intelligence Saving Throw with a DC of 8 + your Intelligence modifier + your Proficiency bonus, or feel compelled to move to the new position immediately. Targets moved this way do not gain temporary hit points. This movement can provoke attacks of opportunity.

{@bold Flanking Maneuvers:} If two allies you move are on opposite sides of a creature after the movement you grant, the first one to attack that enemy has advantage on their first attack if they attack before the creature moves.
{@bold Coordinated Transitions:} Allies can move through each other's spaces during the movement you grant without it being difficult terrain.

subclassFeature.name: Tactical Strike
entries: Starting at 11th level, when you succeed on a {@classFeature Leadership Dice|Warlord|KT-CLL|2|KT-CLL|Tactical Insight} check against a creature, the next damage roll made by you or an ally against it before the start of your next turn is increased by {@damage 2d6}.

subclassFeature.name: Advanced Orders
entries: Additionally at 15th level, when you expend Leadership Die on {@classFeature Leadership Dice|Warlord|KT-CLL|2|KT-CLL|Urgent Orders}, you can allow the target to use their reaction to immediately take one of the following actions instead of moving: Use an Object, Search, Hide, or Dodge.

subclassFeature.name: Unstoppable Schemes
entries: Starting at 18th level, standing in your way becomes a pointless endeavor. When you move your allies with {@classFeature Leadership Dice|Warlord|KT-CLL|2|KT-CLL|Urgent Orders} or {@classFeature Shift the Field|Warlord|KT-CLL|14}, they can move through spaces occupied by hostile creatures so long as they do not end their movement in an occupied space.

subclassFeature.name: Multilayered Tactics
entries: Additionally at 18th level, when you succeed on a {@classFeature Leadership Dice|Warlord|KT-CLL|2|KT-CLL|Tactical Insight} check against a creature, you can choose two of the listed effects.

subclassFeature.name: Dancer's Presence
entries: A unique presence on the battlefield, these graceful agents wind their way through death and destruction with a curious elegance, uplifting their allies and distracting their enemies. A dancer comes in many forms, be they prancing jesters or graceful enchanters, their presence seems supernaturally captivating to all who encounter them, for good or ill.
Though they seem out of place in danger, confused onlookers will often find them as the last ones standing in the most dangerous of situations, always one step out of out the greatest danger.

subclassFeature.name: Dancer's Grace
entries: Starting at 1st level when you take this Presence, you gain proficiency with {@skill Performance}. If you already have proficiency with performance, you gain expertise with it, meaning you can add twice your proficiency bonus to checks made with it.
Additionally, while you are not wearing armor or carrying a shield, you gain an unarmored defense that is 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Charisma modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Graceful Entrance
entries: Starting at 1st level, you can give yourself a bonus to your initiative rolls equal to your Charisma modifier. Additionally when you roll initiative and are not surprised, you can move up to your half movement speed, and you and any creature you end this movement within 5 feet of gains temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Bewildering Steps
entries: At 3rd level, you gain an additional use for {@classFeature Leadership Dice|Warlord|KT-CLL|2}.

entries.name: Distract
entries: As a bonus action, you attempt to distract a creature within 30 feet. Until the start of your next turn, if that creature attacks a creature other than you while you are within range of its attack, you can roll your leadership die and subtract it from their attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Dancer's Dodge
entries: Starting at 3rd level, when you take the {@action Dodge} action while you are not wearing armor or carrying a shield, you can use {@subclassFeature Bewildering Steps|Warlord|KT-CLL|Dancer|KT-CLL|3|KT-CLL|Distract}, {@classFeature Leadership Dice|Warlord|KT-CLL|2|KT-CLL|Helpful Word}, {@classFeature Leadership Dice|Warlord|KT-CLL|2|KT-CLL|Urgent Orders}, or {@classFeature Leadership Dice|Warlord|KT-CLL|2|KT-CLL|Rallying Mark} without expending a leadership die. When you do so, it applies as if you had spent 1 leadership die on it for its effect.

Additionally, when you take the {@action Dodge} action, you can expend leadership dice to grant attacks through Battlefield Presence. You can grant a number of attacks equal to the leadership dice spent, up to your per turn limit.

subclassFeature.name: Battlefield Grace
entries: Starting at 7th level, whenever a creature misses you with an attack, you regain 1 spent {@classFeature Leadership Dice|Warlord|KT-CLL|2|KT-CLL|Leadership Die} and can move 5 feet. You cannot regain a leadership die this way again until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Whirling Thorns
entries: Additionally at 7th level, if you are carrying a melee weapon with the light property, you can make a single attack with it as a bonus action. You can expend {@classFeature Leadership Dice|Warlord|KT-CLL|2} to make additional attacks as part of the same action, but each attack must be against a different target within range. If you have taken {@subclassFeature Dancer's Dodge|Warlord|KT-CLL|Dancer|KT-CLL|3|KT-CLL}, You can attack one additionally target (as if you'd spent a Leadership Die on the ability).

subclassFeature.name: Furious Tempo
entries: Starting at 11th level, you can add your Charisma modifier to the damage of attacks you make or grant through {@classFeature Battlefield Presence|Warlord|KT-CLL|1}.

subclassFeature.name: Evasion
entries: Starting at 15th level, you can nimbly dodge out of the way of certain area effects. When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

subclassFeature.name: Elegant Exchange
entries: Starting at 18th level, when an willing creature within 15 feet of you is the target of a spell, attack, or targeted effect that would cause them to take damage, you can move their position as a reaction, moving them 5 feet in any direction and becoming the target of the attack.

subclassFeature.name: Dreadlord's Presence
entries: A warlord that follows this path specializes in terror and fear, usually localized to their enemies. While other warlords look to boost and inspire their allies, a Dreadlord works to undermine and terrify their enemies, crushing their will to fight and leaving them as prey easily slaughtered.

A dreadlord is not always evil, though they most often show up in the ranks of evil, but by their very nature they are someone that can instill dread and terror. The source of this dread can be cursed visage, supernatural gift, or simply a tyrannical force of will.

subclassFeature.name: Dreadlord Proficiency
entries: Starting at 1st level when you select this Presence, you gain proficiency in heavy armor and the {@skill Intimidation} skill.

subclassFeature.name: Unapproachable
entries: Additionally at 1st level, your intimidating presence causes your foes to falter at the start of combat. After rolling initiative, the first attack by the first hostile creature to attack an allied creature within 30 feet of you has disadvantage.

subclassFeature.name: Demoralization Dice
entries: Starting at 3rd level, whenever you spend a {@classFeature Leadership Dice|Warlord|KT-CLL|2|KT-CLL|Leadership Die}, you gain a special Demoralization Die of equal size. Demoralization Dice last until you have gone 1 minute without earning or spending one. You can spend Demoralization Die as a reaction on one of the following effects:

items: {@bold Make it Excruciating.} When a creature within 30 feet of you takes damage from a weapon attack roll made by an ally of yours, as a reaction you can expend Demoralization Dice (up to your Leadership Die limit), rolling them and causing the target to take additional damage of the same damage type equal the value of the rolled dice.
{@bold Don't Touch That.} When a creature attacks an allied creature within 30 feet of you, as a reaction you can expend one Demoralization Dice, rolling it and reducing the attacker's attack roll.

{@bold Are You Sure?} When a creature ends their turn within 5 feet of you, as a reaction you can expend Demoralization Dice (up to your Leadership Die limit) and force the creature to make a Wisdom saving throw (DC 8 + your Charisma modifier + your proficiency bonus). On failure, the creature uses their reaction to move a number of feet away from you equal to 10  the Demoralization Dice spent. The target automatically passes if they are immune to the frightened condition.

subclassFeature.name: Supernatural Dread
entries: Starting at 7th level, you can use {@classFeature Leadership Dice|Warlord|KT-CLL|2} (up to your per turn limit) to cast {@spell cause fear|XGE} without a spell slot. The level of the spell is equal to the number of Leadership Dice spent.

Alternatively, can spend 3 Leadership Dice (even if it exceeds your per turn limit) to instead cast {@spell fear|PHB} without expending a spell slot or material component once. After you do this, you cannot cast fear this way again until you complete a long rest. Charisma is your spell casting modifier for these spells.

subclassFeature.name: Iron Mask
entries: Additionally at 7th level, you are exceptionally good at masking your emotions. Creatures have disadvantage on Wisdom (Insight) ability checks against you.

Additionally, you can suppress the effect of the {@condition frightened} condition on yourself, but it requires concentration (as if concentrating on a spell). You cannot lose concentration on the effect, but cannot maintain it while concentrating on spell.

subclassFeature.name: Punish the Weak
entries: Starting at 11th level, when you target a creature within 60 feet of you with any ability, feature, or attack, you can mark them for punishment (no action required). The mark lasts until the creature ends their turn more than 60 feet from you, dies, or you mark another creature. Once per turn when the marked creature takes damage, they take an additional {@damage 1d8} damage. This is increased to {@damage 1d12} if the target is {@condition frightened} of you.

subclassFeature.name: Instinctive Flinch
entries: Starting at 15th level, when a creature passes a Wisdom saving throw against one of your features that would cause them to become {@condition frightened} or flee, they still gain disadvantage on their next attack role made before the start of your next turn. This has no effect if the target is immune to the frightened condition.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Dominion
entries: Additionally at 15th level, the range of your {@subclassFeature Demoralization Dice|Warlord|KT-CLL|Dreadlord|KT-CLL|3|KT-CLL} effects are doubled (making them 60 feet, 60 feet, and 10 feet, respectively).

subclassFeature.name: Dreadful Terror
entries: Starting at 18th level, when a target becomes {@condition frightened} of you, you can expend {@subclassFeature Demoralization Dice|Warlord|KT-CLL|Dreadlord|KT-CLL|3|KT-CLL} to enhance the effect (no action required)

items: {@bold Panicked Terror.} The target immediately spends their reaction to move up to half of their movement speed away from you.
{@bold Blind Terror.} You can expend 2 Demoralization Dice to cause the target become blinded until the start of your next turn.
{@bold Paralyzing Terror.} You can expend 3 Demoralization Dice to cause the target to become paralyzed until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Knife of Fate
entries: While you have temporary hit points from {@subclassFeature Thread of Fate|Occultist|KT-CLL|Voidwatcher|KT-CLL|6|KT-CLL}, when you hit a creature with an attack roll you can expend them to deal damage equal to half the temporary hit points expended (rounded down).

optionalfeature.name: Plans Within Plans
entries: When you empower a psionic power that has an attack roll or saving throw, you regain half of the Influence Points powers spent (rounded up) if the attack misses or the target succeeds their saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Chaotic Thesis
entries: When you use your {@subclassFeature Void Gaze|Occultist|KT-CLL|Voidwatcher|KT-CLL|3|KT-CLL} or {@subclassFeature They Watch|Occultist|KT-CLL|Voidwatcher|KT-CLL|14|KT-CLL} feature, you can choose which effect you want, selecting any of the {@subclassFeature Eschatological Conclusion|Occultist|KT-CLL|Voidwatcher|KT-CLL|1|KT-CLL} effects. You can select different effects for each eye for the {@subclassFeature They Watch|Occultist|KT-CLL|Voidwatcher|KT-CLL|14|KT-CLL} feature.

optionalfeature.name: Conviction of Annihilation
entries: Your conviction toward your thesis grows, allowing you to draw on additional aspects of it and learn the following spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the table below. These are Occultist spells for you, but do not count against your spells known.

optionalfeature.name: Conviction of Madness
entries: Your conviction toward your thesis grows, allowing you to draw on additional aspects of it and learn the following spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the table below. These are Occultist spells for you, but do not count against your spells known.

optionalfeature.name: Conviction of Tranquility
entries: Your conviction toward your thesis grows, allowing you to draw on additional aspects of it and learn the following spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the table below. These are Occultist spells for you, but do not count against your spells known.

optionalfeature.name: Cycle of Annihilation
entries: When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with {@subclassFeature Void Gaze|Occultist|KT-CLL|Voidwatcher|KT-CLL|3|KT-CLL}, you can immediately use the ability again targeting another creature within range as part of the same action. You can do this a maximum number of times in a turn equal to your proficiency bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Dance of the Mad Puppet
entries: When a target is compelled to move by an Occultist spell you cast, you can pick the direction the target moves, even if you would normally not be able to (for example, a spell that causes the target to run away from you can be used to make the target run in any direction). This does not change a target's willingness to enter hazardous spaces.

optionalfeature.name: Disciple of Discord
entries: You thrive on chaos and discord. Any time you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that causes a target creature to become act against their will, become frightened, or take psychic damage, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Wisdom modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Doombringer
entries: When you roll a Fate Die for a creature using the {@subclassFeature Eye of the End|Occultist|KT-CLL|Voidwatcher|KT-CLL|5|KT-CLL}, you can subtract your Wisdom modifier from the roll determining the result of their next save.

optionalfeature.name: Ending Spoilers
entries: You can use your {@subclassFeature Eye of the End|Occultist|KT-CLL|Voidwatcher|KT-CLL|5|KT-CLL} feature as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Piercing Gaze
entries: If a creature ends its turn within the cone of sight of one the eyes created by {@subclassFeature They Watch|Occultist|KT-CLL|Voidwatcher|KT-CLL|14|KT-CLL}, it has disadvantage on saving throws against your spells until the start of its next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Inexorable Annihilation
entries: Creatures that fail a saving throw against your 1st level or higher Occultist spells that deal damage gain lingering cracks in their form which slowly erode them. They take {@damage 1d6} force damage at the end of each their turns. This ends after dealing damage if the creature is more than 120 feet from you, you cannot see the creature, or you are {@condition incapacitated}.

optionalfeature.name: Reflexive Annihilation
entries: When you take damage from another creature within 60 feet of you, you can temporarily let loose the annihilation within you as revenge. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC, taking a number of d6 dice equal to your proficiency bonus as force damage on failure, and half the damage on a success. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you complete a short rest.

optionalfeature.name: Self Reflection
entries: When grant temporary hit points with {@subclassFeature Void Gaze|Occultist|KT-CLL|Voidwatcher|KT-CLL|3|KT-CLL|Conclusion of Tranquility} to another creature, you gain an equal number of temporary hit points.

optionalfeature.name: Serene Acceptance
entries: You remain calm and unperturbed by the chaos around you, as you wait calmly for the end of reality. You gain advantage on Constitution saving throws to maintain concentration on spells, and advantage on any ability check to maintain a calm state of mind, expression, or demeanor.

optionalfeature.name: This is Fine
entries: You remain unperturbed in even the most dire circumstances. You become immune to the {@condition frightened} condition.

optionalfeature.name: True Voidsight
entries: You gain {@sense truesight} for the duration of your {@subclassFeature Void Gaze|Occultist|KT-CLL|Voidwatcher|KT-CLL|3|KT-CLL}.

optionalfeature.name: Tranquil Touch
entries: When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher on a creature, you can choose to end the {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}  condition on that creature.

optionalfeature.name: Unflinching Gaze
entries: You gain an additional use of your {@subclassFeature Void Gaze|Occultist|KT-CLL|Voidwatcher|KT-CLL|3|KT-CLL} feature, and no longer have to make a saving throw against {@condition blindness} when the feature ends when using it again before completing a short rest.

optionalfeature.name: Unmaking Eye
entries: When you use your {@subclassFeature Eye of the End|Occultist|KT-CLL|Voidwatcher|KT-CLL|5|KT-CLL} feature, your next melee weapon attack against the target creature becomes a critical hit.

optionalfeature.name: Wildcard
entries: You can no longer choose which option to use with your {@subclassFeature Void Gaze|Occultist|KT-CLL|Voidwatcher|KT-CLL|3|KT-CLL}, but roll randomly to determine the effect. In exchange, the effect gains additional die of temporary hit points or damage (for example, {@subclassFeature Void Gaze|Occultist|KT-CLL|Voidwatcher|KT-CLL|3|KT-CLL|Conclusion of Annihilation} would deal {@damage 2d8} force damage). You can pick the target after rolling for the effect.

optionalfeature.name: Alchemical Rites
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item alchemist's supplies|PHB}. During a long rest, you can use them to concoct an improvised {@item Potion of Healing|PHB} by spending 1 hour of the long rest to tend to its simmering. Due to its improvised nature, it expires in 24 hours, and has no value in gold pieces.
During this process, you can expend a 5th level spell to brew a {@item Potion of Greater Healing|PHB} instead. The expended spell slot is regained when the long rest is completed as normal.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Magic
entries: You gain the {@feat Hemomancer|KT-CLL} feat.

entries.name: Limited Availability
entries: This feat is only available when using the optional blood magic spells (presented later in the book).

optionalfeature.name: Emblazoned Focus
entries: You emblazon a mystical mark on yourself via a tattoo, scar, or similar permanent mark. You can use this mark as your spellcasting focus for your Occultist spells. You no longer need a free hand to cast spells with somatic or material components, as you can channel your magic through the mark, though it glows visibly when you do so. The mark must remain uncovered to function as a spellcasting focus (casting in this way does not remove the signs of casting a spell, it merely means you do not need a free hand).

You can use this mark as your spellcasting focus for your Occultist spells. You no longer need a free hand to cast spells with somatic or material components, as you can channel your magic through the mark, though it glows visibly when you do so. The mark must remain uncovered to function as a spellcasting focus (casting in this way does not remove the signs of casting a spell, it merely means you do not need a free hand).

optionalfeature.name: Expert of Tradition
entries: Choose a skill you are proficient in from among {@skill Animal Handling}, {@skill Arcana}, {@skill Medicine}, {@skill Nature}, and {@skill Survival}. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses the chosen proficiency. If you do not have proficiency in any of the selected skills, you instead gain proficiency in one of your choice.

optionalfeature.name: Forbidden Rites
entries: You learn the {@spell animate dead|PHB} spell. It is an Occultist spell for you and does not count against the number of Occultist spells you know. This spell cannot gain the ritual tag with {@optfeature Lost Ritual|KT-CLL}.

optionalfeature.name: Lost Ritual
entries: You learn of a ritual lost to time. Select an Occultist spell you know of 5th level or lower. This spell gains the ritual tag. You can cast this spell as a ritual once, and must complete a short or long rest before casting it as a ritual again.

foundrySystem.activation.condition: When you cast the selected spell

optionalfeature.name: Markings of Protections
entries: You mark yourself with magical symbols and patterns, protecting you from harm. While you are not wearing any armor, your AC becomes 11 + your Wisdom modifier. You can use a shield and still gain this benefit.

optionalfeature.name: Occult Magic
entries: Your Occultist spells known increases by one. You can select this rite multiple times.

optionalfeature.name: Occult Shield
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item shield|PHB|shields}. Your shield can serve as an Occult Fetish for your Occultist spells.

optionalfeature.name: Occult Sight
entries: You gain the ability to see invisible creatures within 30 feet if those creatures are undead or fey. You gain advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks to detect creatures made of or animated by magic (such as constructs, elementals, or undead).

optionalfeature.name: Protective Ward
entries: You make a ward against supernatural harm. While you wear this charm, you can use it to cast {@spell protection from evil and good|PHB} without expending a spell slot, material components, or requiring concentration, but the spell lasts a number of rounds equal to your Wisdom modifier.
You can cast this as a reaction to being attacked or making a save it would affect, but when you do so it only lasts until the start of your next turn.
Once you use this charm, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Rite of Immortality
entries: You continue to age, but you will no longer die of old age, and suffer none of the frailty of old age.

optionalfeature.name: Rite of Youth
entries: You cease to visually age, and can even choose to become more youthful in appearance, though your lifespan remains the natural lifespan of your race.

optionalfeature.name: Root of Magic
entries: You learn 10 cantrips from any class lists of your choice. They are Occultist spells for you.

optionalfeature.name: Spatial Storage
entries: You can convert a pocket, ring, hat, or bag into a spatial storage device, capable of carrying up to 5 x your Occultist level pounds, with 0.5 x your Occultist level cubic feet of storage space. For example, a level 5 Occultist can store up to 25 pounds, not exceeding a volume of 2.5 cubic feet, within the storage space.
As an action, you can send an item you are holding into the storage space or retrieve an item from the storage space to your hand.
If lost, you can recreate the spatial storage device during a short rest.

optionalfeature.name: Specialized Poisons
entries: When you deal poison damage with an Occultist spell or created poison, you can (but don't have to) specify a creature type (such as beast or monstrosity) it is created to affect. Damage from that spell or poison ignores resistance and immunity to poison damage by creatures of that type. Creatures without the selected creature type have resistance to poison damage from the spell effect or poison.

optionalfeature.name: Spirit Sense
entries: You gain the ability to gaze into the spiritual world around you. As an action, you can gain a special form of sight that lasts 1 minute. While under the effect of this special sight, you are blind beyond 30 feet, but within 30 feet you can see into the ethereal plane. Within this sight range you have advantage on ability checks and saving throws to detect and see through illusions, see invisible creatures, and perceive the original form of a shapechanger or transformed creature.

optionalfeature.name: Soulburn
entries: You can make your powers sear the very soul of the creature they strike. When you deal cold, fire or lightning damage, you can choose to deal necrotic damage instead.

optionalfeature.name: Sympathetic Bond
entries: You learn the {@spell warding bond|PHB} spell. It is an Occultist spell for you, but does not count against your spells known.

When you cast warding bond, you can choose to increase the power of the bond. When you do so, if either bonded creature makes an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw, both creatures make the save. If either succeeds on the saving throw, both succeed, but if both fail, both are affected by the condition being saved against, even if only one was targeted. If both creatures are saving against the same effect, they do not roll twice, but both succeed if either succeeds on the saving throws and only fail if both fail the saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Vestments of War
entries: You gain proficiency with {@filter medium armor|items|source=PHB|type=medium armor}.

entries.name: Losing Invested Objects
entries: If a Rite creates an object, you can recreate that object if it is lost or destroyed. If the rules are not specified elsewhere, it is a process that requires any base object the Rite did and 4 hours of time. If the original still exists anywhere, it loses its magical properties when you complete this process.

optionalfeature.name: Animate Broom
entries: You infuse an object (traditionally a broom) but any vaguely broom-shaped object (like a staff, spear, or similar) can be used with flying magic, turning it into a {@item Broom of Flying|DMG}. If your broom is lost or destroyed, you can create a new one during 8 hours of work. If a previous broom still exists when you make a new one, it loses its magic upon the completion of the new one.

optionalfeature.name: Divine Presence
entries: Your familiar is always under the effect of the {@spell sanctuary|PHB} spell (using your spell save DC). If it deals damage (such as channeling one of your spells), the effect is suppressed until the start of its next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Animate Hair
entries: As an action, you can expend a 1st-level spell slot to cause your hair to lengthen, strengthen, and spring to life for 1 minute. When you use this feature and as an action on your subsequent turns while it is animated you can make melee spell attack with a range of 10 feet, dealing {@damage 1d8} bludgeoning damage on hit. This damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th Level ({@damage 2d8}), 11th level ({@damage 3d8}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d8}). If you hit a Large or smaller creature with this attack, as a bonus action you can attempt to {@action grapple} the creature with your hair using your Wisdom modifier in place of your Strength modifier to initiate and maintain grapple. Your reach with touch spells is also increased to 10 feet while it is animated.

A {@condition grappled} creature can contest the grapple as normal, or deal 5 slashing, fire, or acid damage to the hair to free themselves. The hair has an AC of 12, and you take no damage when it is attacked.

optionalfeature.name: Companion Coven
entries: As a ritual that takes 1 hour, you can form a coven bond with one willing creature. While both of you are conscious and within 120 feet of each other, you gain the ability to share spell slots up to a maximum spell slot of your Witch level divided by four (rounded down).

While this bond is active, you can use your Spellcasting feature to cast using their spell slots (consuming them as normal), and they can use their Spellcasting feature (if they have one) to cast using your spell slots (consuming them as normal).

Additionally, you know their location at all times while they are part of your coven and within 120 feet of you. You can only be bonded to one creature with this bond at a time. You can end this coven at any time.

optionalfeature.name: Curse Specialist
entries: All the curses and hexes from other covens are added to your Occultist spell list as options you can pick when learn new spells. In addition, when you select this rite, you can select one curse or hex spell of a level you can cast to learn, and it does not count against your spells known.

optionalfeature.name: Evil Eye
entries: You gain the ability to lay the most unsettling gaze upon a creature. As a reaction to a creature within 15 feet attacking you, you can unleash a terrifying glare at them (occurring after the attack completes). The target creature must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or become {@condition frightened} of you until the end of your next turn. Once a creature has succeeded on a save against this ability, they are immune to it for 24 hours.
Additionally, you gain proficiency in the {@skill Intimidation} skill.

foundrySystem.activation.condition: A creature within 15 feet attacks you

optionalfeature.name: Familiar Swap
entries: If your familiar is within 60 feet of you, as an action, you can swap places with your familiar. If you cannot fit into the space where your familiar is, the ability fails and you take 1d6 force damage. Once you use this Rite, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

foundrySystem.activation.condition: If your familiar is within 60 feet of you

optionalfeature.name: Form of the Familiar
entries: You learn the {@spell form of familiar|KT-CLL} spell and gain the ability to cast it once without expending a spell slot as an action. You regain the ability to cast it in this way again after completing a short or long rest. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have.

optionalfeature.name: Light of the Moon
entries: You can channel to power of the moon, drawing its light following ancient traditions. You learn the spells {@spell faerie fire|PHB} and {@spell moonbeam|PHB}. When you cast either of this spells, allied creatures of your choice within the area of effect are not affected, and instead gain temporary hit points equal to your Wisdom modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Ray of Enfeeblement
entries: You learn the {@spell ray of enfeeblement|PHB} spell and you can cast it once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast it in this way again after completing a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Riding Familiar
entries: If you have a familiar without a flying speed, as an action you can make them become a creature one size larger than you (up to Large sized) for 8 hours. As an action, you can revert your familiar to its normal size. At 12th level, you can use this ability on a familiar with a flying speed. Once you use this rite, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again. Your familiar's strength becomes 10 while enlarged, if it was not already higher.

optionalfeature.name: Skulking Familiar
entries: Any familiar summoned by you gains proficiency in the Stealth skill and its movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

optionalfeature.name: Witch's Brew
entries: During a short or long rest, you can infuse a spell with a casting time of one action or bonus action into a concoction, expending the spell slot or consumed material components on completion of the rest.

This spell can subsequently be cast by anyone carrying the potion by drinking the potion as an action (not requiring any spell slots or components), with the drinker as the target, acting as the caster of the spell, but using your spellcasting ability modifier.
The potion remains potent until you complete a long rest and recharge the spell slot expended to create the potion.

optionalfeature.name: Witch's Claws
entries: As an action, you can form your fingernails (or similar physiological feature if you do not have fingernails) form into wicked claws and you make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet of you.

On hit, the target takes 1d10 + your Wisdom modifier slashing damage. This damage increases by 1d10 when you reach 5th level (2d10), 11th level (3d10), and 17th level (4d10). At 6th level, you can apply your {@classFeature Witch's Touch|Occultist|KT-CLL|Witch|KT-CLL} feature when you hit with this attack (including potentially dealing your Wisdom modifier damage twice).

optionalfeature.name: Witch's Hat
entries: You invest a hat (traditionally a floppy wide brimmed black witch's hat) with some of your magic, turning it into a {@item Hat of Disguise|DMG}. If your hat is lost or destroyed, you can create a new one with 2 hours of work. If a previous hat still exists when you make a new one, it loses its magic upon the completion of the new one.

optionalfeature.name: Wicked Curse
entries: You learn the {@spell bestow curse|PHB} spell. When you cast bestow curse, you can select two of the listed options.

optionalfeature.name: Hedge Magic
entries: You learn an additional cantrip from the Occultist list or from the expanded list provided by the {@classFeature Practical Skills|Occultist|KT-CLL|Hedge Mage|KT-CLL} feature.

optionalfeature.name: Hedge Knight
entries: You gain proficiency in heavy armor.

optionalfeature.name: I Know That One!
entries: When you make a saving throw against a spell you know, or make a spellcasting ability check to use {@spell counterspell|PHB} or {@spell dispel magic|PHB} against a spell you know, you have advantage on the saving throw or spellcasting ability check.

optionalfeature.name: Learning on the Fly
entries: When you pass a saving throw against a spell of 5th level or lower, you gain the ability to cast that spell for the next minute (expending any spell slots or components it would normally require to cast it).

optionalfeature.name: Manipulate Magic
entries: You learn one Metamagic option of your choice from the Sorcerer class. You can use this Metamagic option once, regaining the ability to use it again after completing a long rest. When using it this way, you use it as if you expended 3 or less sorcery points.
You can use it again before completing a long rest by expending a spell slot of a level equal to the number of sorcery points the Metamagic would cost to use.

optionalfeature.name: Mass Cantrip
entries: When you cast an Occultist cantrip that targets one or more creatures, you can make the cantrip target a number additional creatures within range equal to your proficiency bonus. Once you use this rite in this way, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again. You can instead expend a spell slot to gain a similar effect, causing the cantrip to target a number of additional creatures equal to the level of spell slot spent.

optionalfeature.name: Mastered Basics
