entries: When you cast an Occultist spell you know using a 1st-level spell slot, it is cast as if you spent a 2nd-level spell slot instead.

optionalfeature.name: Practice Makes Perfect
entries: You've cast a spell so many times it has become second nature. Select a 1st level Occultist spell you know. You can cast this spell without expending a spell slot a number of times equal to half your proficiency bonus (rounded up), regaining all uses when you complete a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Practiced Reach
entries: When you use the Way I Learned It feature to add range, you can make the range of the spell up to 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Potent Cantrip
entries: Your damaging cantrips affect even creatures that avoid the brunt of the effect. When a creature succeeds on a saving throw against your cantrip, the creature takes half the cantrip's damage (if any) but suffers no additional effect from the cantrip.

optionalfeature.name: Ready-Made Spell
entries: Over the course of 1 minute, you can perform a special ritual to cast a spell into an item, expending a spell slot as normal. The spell being stored has no immediate effect when cast this way. Thereafter, a creature holding the item that is aware there is magic infused it can trigger the stored magic, with the effect of casting the spell.

The spell uses your spell save DC, spell attack bonus, and spell casting ability, but is all other ways treated as if the creature holding it cast the spell. You can infuse a number of spell levels equal to your proficiency bonus this, regaining the ability to infuse more when you complete a long rest. Any items infused this way lose their power if you regain the spell slot used to infuse the item.

optionalfeature.name: Savant Focus
entries: You can focus all of your experience into using your most basic magic potently. As a bonus action you can enter a state of focused concentration, as if concentrating on a spell. When you do so, you gain advantage on attack rolls made for cantrips for 1 minute, or until you end your concentration on this state of focus.

optionalfeature.name: Studious Mage
entries: You can select spell a from the Wizard or Druid spell list, but only of a spell level lower than the highest level spell level you can cast. You learn the spell and it becomes an Occultist spell for you.

optionalfeature.name: Simple Magic
entries: Even as you gain power, you are adept with using small bursts for simple magic. You can sacrifice a spell slot of 3rd level or higher to gain two 1st-level spell slots. If the spell slot is 5th level or higher, you can gain two 2nd-level spell slots. You cannot store more than twice your usual maximum number of any spell slot level this way.

optionalfeature.name: The Way I Learned To Improvise
entries: When you cast a spell as a higher level than its default level, you can modify it on the fly with The Way I Learned It, changing one property for each level above its normal spell slot level (in addition to any normal effects of upcasting the spell).

optionalfeature.name: Utility Master
entries: When you cast cantrips that can lift weight, affect external elements, target an area on the ground, or cause minor instantaneous effects, you lift twice as much, target twice the area, or maintain an additional instantaneous effect.

optionalfeature.name: Death Watcher
entries: You can see the lines of fate, and detect when one of them is about to snap. When an ally that can see or hear you would drop to 0 hit points as a result of taking damage, as a reaction you can manipulate their fate with a cryptic warning, causing them to narrowly avoid their demise, instead dropping to 1 hit point.
Once you use this Rite, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again.

optionalfeature.name: Divine Miracle
entries: You learn one cleric spell of your choice. The spell must be of a level you can cast, as shown on the Occultist table, or a cantrip. The chosen spell becomes an Occultist spell for you and does not count against your spells known.

optionalfeature.name: Divine Sight
entries: If you have blindsight, you gain {@sense truesight} with a range equal to your blindsight.

optionalfeature.name: Oracle's Sight
entries: You gain blindsight with a range of 15 feet. When affected by the {@condition Blinded|PHB} conditionfor more than a minute the range of this sight is doubled while under that effect.

optionalfeature.name: Revelation of Darkness
entries: You understand that darkness is all encompassing, interrupted only by tenuous motes of light. When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher creates that dim light, darkness, or that obscures you from the vision of one or more creatures, you can teleport to another point you can see that is in dim light or darkness within 30 feet as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Revelation of Death
entries: You can manipulate negative energy. When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that deals cold or necrotic damage, you can add your Wisdom modifier to one damage roll of that spell. Channeling the power of death in this way temporarily withers and weakens you, reducing your movement speed by 5 feet until the end of your next turn.
If you use this while already weakened in this way, the duration is extended and the effect is cumulative.
A spell can only trigger one Revelation. If multiple Revelations apply, choose one.

optionalfeature.name: Revelation of Fire
entries: Your powers draw flames all around you. When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that deals fire damage, you can shroud yourself in flames until the start of your next turn. You gain half cover and any creature that strikes you with a melee attack or ends their turn within 5 feet of you takes {@damage 1d6} fire damage. At the start of your next turn, you take {@damage 1} fire damage.
A spell can only trigger one Revelation. If multiple Revelations apply, choose one.

optionalfeature.name: Revelation of Life
entries: Your powers are tied to the nature of life and its ever shifting balance. When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that restores hit points or grants temporary hit points, you can heal a creature other than yourself within 30 feet for a number of hit points equal to your Occultist level. Your current hit points are reduced by half as many hit points as you restore with this feature.
You can only use this ability on creatures that have vibrant life pulsing within them.
This revelation does not work on undead, constructs, or creatures at zero hit points. A spell can only trigger one Revelation. If multiple Revelations apply, choose one.

optionalfeature.name: Revelation of Light
entries: You grasp that looking into the light blinds as surely as looking away from it. When you cast {@spell prismatic flash|KT-CLL} or a 1st level spell or higher spell that sheds 5 feet or more of bright light, as a bonus action you can force one creature within 30 feet of the light to make a Dexterity saving throw, or become blinded until the start of your next turn.
A creature is unaffected by this effect if it can't see, if it relies on senses other than sight, such as blindsight, or if it can perceive illusions as false, as with truesight.

optionalfeature.name: Revelation of Nature
entries: When you cast a 1st level spell or higher that creates difficult terrain, you can force one creature to make a Dexterity saving throw. On failure, if the creature is within the area of the spell creates difficult terrain, its movement speed is reduced to zero. If it is outside the area of difficult terrain, its movement speed is reduced by half.

optionalfeature.name: Revelation of Souls
entries: The souls of the departed are all around. When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, you can conjure a medium sized benevolent or tormented spirit to an empty space you can see within 30 feet.

The first creature to enter the spirit's space or end their turn within the spirit's space gains a number of hit points equal to 1d4 + the level of the spell if you summoned a benevolent spirit, or takes necrotic damage equal to 1d4 + the level of the spell if the spirit was a tormented one. A spell can only trigger one Revelation. If multiple Revelations apply, choose one.

optionalfeature.name: Revelation of War
entries: Within war, you see the essence of perfect conflict. When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher on your turn, you can make a single melee weapon attack as bonus action. When you reach 6th level, you can trigger the Revelation of War when you cast an Occultist cantrip.

optionalfeature.name: Touch of Fire
entries: You learn the {@spell burn|KT-CLL} cantrip. Additionally, as a bonus action you can take 1 fire damage and can cause a weapon you are carrying to burst into flames for 1 minute or until you let go of it. For the duration, it sheds bright light for 10 feet and dim light for an additional 10 feet. Attacks made with the weapon while it burns deal an additional 1d6 fire damage.

optionalfeature.name: Truth of Darkness
entries: Darkness is home to those that live in it. Any darkvision or blindsight you have is doubled in range, up to a maximum of 120 feet. If you have neither, you gain a darkvision of 30 feet, which is doubled by this feature to 60 feet. You can see normally in dim light and darkness.

optionalfeature.name: Truth of Death
entries: The march of death is inexorable. Necrotic damage you deal ignores resistance to Necrotic damage, and treats immunity as resistance, and leaves the touch of death on the target until the start of your next turn. While under the Touch of Death, any hit points the target regains is halved (rounded down).

foundrySystem.activation.condition: When you deal necrotic damage to a creature

optionalfeature.name: Truth of Fire
entries: Everything burns. When you roll fire damage, you can reroll any number of fire damage dice. You must use the new rolls. If you reroll all the dice of the damage roll, the damage bypasses any fire resistance a target has. For each die rerolled, you take 1 fire damage which can't be reduced in any way.

optionalfeature.name: Truth of Life
entries: The breath of life is shared by all creatures. When a creature of CR 1/4 or higher dies within 60 feet of you, you can use your reaction to transfer some of that dispersing life force to another creature within 60 feet of you (including yourself). The target creature gains hit points equal to your Wisdom modifier, or the maximum hit points of the creature (whichever was lower).

foundrySystem.activation.condition: When a creature dies within 60 feet of you

optionalfeature.name: Truth of Light
entries: The light reveals all. Magical bright light you create reveals invisible creatures, any attempt to hide within it is made with disadvantage, and grants advantage on saving throws and ability against illusions. You can end these effects for the duration of that bright light on a source of bright light as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Truth of Nature
entries: You can cast {@spell speak with plants|PHB} or {@spell speak with animals|PHB} without expending a spell slot. Once you do so, you cannot do so again until you complete a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Truth of Souls
entries: You are one with the souls. You have advantage on Constitution saving throws to maintain concentration on spells granted by the Mystery of Souls.

optionalfeature.name: Truth of War
entries: There are many paths to victory. When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher on your turn, the next time you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack before the end of your turn, you can force them to make a Saving Throw against your Spell Save DC, or suffer from a condition based on the level of spell slot cast (you can select the condition of a lower level effect instead of you choose) until the start of your next turn. The type of saves and conditions are listed on the table below.

optionalfeature.name: Twin Revelation
entries: When you cast a spell that invokes a Revelation, you can invoke two different Revelations at the same time.

optionalfeature.name: Halo of Mystery
entries: When you roll initiative or as a bonus action at any time, you can invoke the power of a mystery you know, causing its power to swirl around you forming a halo. This halo lasts until you invoke another Mystery this way, or dismiss it as a bonus action. It's effect depends on the Mystery Invoked.

items: {@b Darkness.} You shrouded in darkness and difficult to make out. You have half cover against attacks and are considered to be in dim light regardless of the surrounding light.

{@b Death.} You gain resistance to necrotic damage. If you are reduced to 0 hit points, you can make a Wisdom saving throw with a DC of 10 + the damage taken to be reduced to 1 hit point instead on success.
{@b Fire.} You shed bright light in a 5 foot radius and dim light for an additional 5 feet. You gain resistance to fire damage, and immunity to the fire damage of your own spells.
{@b Life.} When you restore hit points to another creature, they gain temporary hit points equal to half the hit points restored.
{@b Light.} You shed bright light in a 20 foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet (this light interacts with Truth of Light if you have that Rite). You gain resistance to radiant damage.
{@b Nature.} You become surrounded by thorny vines. Any creature that strikes you with a melee weapon attack takes {@damage 1d8} piercing damage.
{@b Souls.} You become ghostly and translucent, gaining a flying speed of 20 feet and can pass through objects less than a foot thick, as well as through creatures, and ignore all difficult terrain.
{@b War.} When you take damage, you can subtract your Wisdom modifier from the damage taken (reducing it to a minimum of 1).

optionalfeature.name: Avatar of the Elements
entries: You learn the {@spell form of fire|KT-CLL}, {@spell form of ice|KT-CLL}, and {@spell form of stone|KT-CLL} spells. These are Occultist spells for you. When you cast one of these spells, you can choose to shorten the duration of the spell to 1 minute. When you do so, the spell does not require concentration.

optionalfeature.name: Dance of the Spirits
entries: When you cast {@spell spirit guardians|PHB}, you can choose the spell's damage type from among cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, and radiant, regardless of your alignment. Additionally, you have advantage on Constitution saves to maintain concentration on spirit guardians and other spell that conjures a spirits.

optionalfeature.name: Detonate Spirit
entries: As an action you can detonate a manifested spirit, causing it to erupt in a flare of power. All creatures within 10 feet of the spirit must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes damage equal to twice the spirit's manifested damage on a failed saving throw, or half as much damage on a successful one if the spirit was empowered with a spell slot. The spirit is immediately released and disappears.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Weapons
entries: You can cast {@spell fists of fire|KT-CLL} or {@spell ice weapon|KT-CLL} when you roll initiative (no action required). When you create a weapon with fists of fire or ice weapon, the damage die of the weapon is increased by one size (for example, from a d6 to a d8).

optionalfeature.name: Energized Weapon
entries: You gain the ability to infuse your weapon with the power granted to you by the spirits. While you have an empowered spirit bonded, as a bonus action you can pour all of its energy into your weapon (recalling it if it is manifested). The next attack with that weapon adds twice the additional damage from the spirit, but the bond immediately expires.

foundrySystem.activation.condition: While you have an empowered spirit bonded

optionalfeature.name: Feral Spirit
entries: While the spirit is empowered by a spell slot, you gain advantage on spell attack rolls you make with a manifested spirit if you or an allied creature that is not {@condition incapacitated} is within 5 feet of the target creature.

optionalfeature.name: Guidance of the Spirits
entries: When you expend a spell slot to empower a spirit with your Empowered Spirits feature, you can select a number of skills equal to the spell slot level expended that the spirit is proficient in. While it is not manifested, you gain proficiency with these skills. If you expend a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can exchange three skill proficiencies to gain expertise in one skill.

optionalfeature.name: Mistwalker
entries: You can see through heavy obscurement when the obscurement is caused by fog, mist, or smoke, natural or otherwise. While you are shrouded by fog, mist, or smoke, you have half cover.

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Bond
entries: When you are empowered by a spirit called by a spell slot of 1st level or higher, you can add the level of the spell slot spent to your Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Primal Earth
entries: You harness the primal elemental powers of earth and stone, learning the following spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the table below. These are Occultist spells for you, but do not count against your spells known.

optionalfeature.name: Primal Fire
entries: You harness the primal elemental power of fire, learning the following spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the table below. These are Occultist spells for you, but do not count against your spells known.

optionalfeature.name: Primal Ice
entries: You harness the primal elemental power of ice, learning the following spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the table below. These are Occultist spells for you, but do not count against your spells known.

optionalfeature.name: Primal Storm
entries: You harness the primal elemental powers of storm and lightning, learning the following spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the table below. These are Occultist spells for you, but do not count against your spells known.

optionalfeature.name: Radiate Power
entries: While you have a spirit bonded to you, as a bonus action you can cause it to emanate power, causing all creatures within 5 feet of you (or it if it is manifested at another location) to make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC. On failure, they take damage equal to the spirit's manifested damage, or half as much on a successful save.

optionalfeature.name: Rite of Prowess
entries: You can select one fighting style from {@optfeature Dueling}, {@optfeature Two-Weapon Fighting}, or {@optfeature Great Weapon Fighting}.

optionalfeature.name: Dueling
entries: When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Two-Weapon Fighting
entries: When you engage in two-weapon fighting, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack.

optionalfeature.name: Great Weapon Fighting
entries: When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a melee weapon that you are wielding with two hands, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2. The weapon must have the two-handed or versatile property for you to gain this benefit.

optionalfeature.name: Shaman's Touch
entries: When you use your action to cast a {@filter cantrip with a range of touch|spells|range=touch|level=0}, you can make one weapon attack as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Shaman's Touch
entries: When you use your action to cast a {@filter cantrip with a range of touch|spells|range=touch|level=0}, you can make one weapon attack as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Strength of Spirit

prerequisite.other: a Strength score higher than your Wisdom score

entries: You can increase your Wisdom ability score by 2, up to a maximum of 20. This cannot make your Wisdom ability score higher than your Strength ability score.

optionalfeature.name: Totemic Rite
entries: You gain the power to place one totem from the Spiritualist Totem Binding feature (selected when you gain this feature). You can place that totem once, after which you must complete a short or long rest before you can place it again.

optionalfeature.name: Warding Power
entries: You learn the {@spell shield|PHB} spell. It becomes an Occultist spell for you, but does not count against your number of spells known.

optionalfeature.name: Chilling Possession
entries: Your Malignant Possession chills the target, reducing the movement speed of the target by 10 feet while under the effect.

optionalfeature.name: Contagious Possession
entries: If a creature dies while under the effect of Malignant Possession, you can force another creature within 30 feet of it to make a Charisma saving throw. On failure, it becomes under the effect of Malignant Possession. You cannot use this feature if the creature died from the effects of Destructive Possession.

optionalfeature.name: Destructive Possession
entries: As an action you can end the Malignant Possession of a creature by denoting the spirit within them, forcing them to make a Charisma saving throw. On failure, they take {@damage 2d8} necrotic damage, or half as much on a successful save. The damTage increases by {@damage 2d8} for each point of proficiency bonus above 2.

optionalfeature.name: Controlled Convulsion
entries: When your Malignant Possession causes the attacker to miss the target with a melee attack, you can redirect the attack to another creature within range of the attack. The new attack makes a new attack roll.

optionalfeature.name: Expansive Totems
entries: The area of effect on your totems that affect a 10 foot radius expands to 15 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Ghost Step
entries: You learn the {@spell ghost step|KT-CLL} spell, and can cast it once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast it again without a spell slot when you complete a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Lethargic Possession
entries: When you use Malignant Possession, the spirit saps the target's energy. They gain 1 level of {@condition exhaustion} while the spirit haunts them. This level of exhaustion ends if the spirit stops haunting them.

optionalfeature.name: Restraining Totem
entries: Your Grasping Totem {@condition restrains} creatures while they are {@condition grappled} by it.

optionalfeature.name: Spirit Eye
entries: You can cast {@spell arcane eye|PHB} without expending a spell slot, with the eye taking the form of an invisible spirit. Once you cast it this way, you cannot cast it this way again until you complete a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Spirit Wards
entries: You gain the effect of {@spell protection from evil and good|PHB} against all incorporeal spirits and undead.

optionalfeature.name: Spiritual Conversationalist
entries: You learn the {@spell speak with dead|PHB} spell and can cast the spell without a spell slot once, regaining the ability to do so again on a long rest.
Additionally, {@spell speak with dead|PHB} is a ritual spell for you.

optionalfeature.name: Totem Master
entries: You regain one use of your Totem Binding feature when you complete a short rest.

optionalfeature.name: Totem Savant
entries: You learn an additional totem from your Totem Binding feature.

optionalfeature.name: Totem Teleport
entries: As a bonus action, you can switch places with any of your totems within 60 feet (teleport to an empty space within 5 feet of it, and the totem teleporting it to a point adjacent to the space you teleported from).

optionalfeature.name: Twin Totems
entries: When you use your Totem Binding feature you call forth two different totems at the same time with a single use of the feature.

optionalfeature.name: Zealous Spirits
entries: You are followed by friendly spirits that protect you. Once per turn, when a creature within 60 feet attacks and hits you, it must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC to avoid the spirits retaliation. On failure, it takes {@damage 2d6} {@damage necrotic} damage, or half as much on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Mystery of Darkness
entries: Your understanding of darkness unlocks the secrets shrouded from others. You learn the following spells at the following levels.

optionalfeature.name: Mystery of Death
entries: Your understanding of the nature of death unlocks its secrets for you. You learn the following spells at the following levels.

optionalfeature.name: Mystery of Fire
entries: Your understanding of the nature of fire unlocks its secrets for you. You learn the following spells at the following levels.

optionalfeature.name: Mystery of Life
entries: Your understanding of the nature of life unlocks its secrets for you. You learn the following spells at the following levels.

optionalfeature.name: Mystery of Light
entries: Your understanding of light illuminates the world in new ways. You learn the following spells at the following levels.

optionalfeature.name: Mystery of Nature
entries: You know the secrets of nature. You learn the following spells at the following levels.

optionalfeature.name: Mystery of Souls
entries: Your understanding of the nature of souls unlocks their secrets for you. You learn the following spells at the following levels.

optionalfeature.name: Mystery of War
entries: Your understanding of the nature of war unlocks its secrets for you. You gain proficiency with simple weapons, medium armor, and shields, and when you make a weapon attack, you can use your Wisdom modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls.
Additionally, you learn the following spells at the following levels.

entries.name: War and Magic
entries: You can expand on the powers granted by your Mysteries with special Oracle specific Occult Rites called Revelations. A Revelation is triggered when you cast a spell. You can trigger only one Revelation per spell cast.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Agility
entries: You are under the effect of the {@spell jump|PHB} spell during the effect.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Armor
entries: You are under the effect of the {@spell mage armor|PHB} spell during the effect.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Fist
entries: The damage of your unarmed strike increases to {@damage 1d10}. If you expend a 3rd-level spell slot on this Aegis Effect, it increases to {@damage 1d12}.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Swiftness
entries: Your movement speed is increased by 5 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Enchantment
entries: You touch a weapon converting its damage type to Fire, Cold, or Lightning while you wield it.

optionalfeature.name: Enchanted Shield
entries: You touch a shield making it easy to wield. You have proficiency with that shield during the effect.

optionalfeature.name: Surging Saves
entries: You can use your Arcane Surge to add your Intelligence modifier to Strength or Dexterity saving throws as well as ability checks (no action required), expending a use as you would to empower an ability check.

optionalfeature.name: Warding Barrier
entries: You reduce all damage taken by 1.

optionalfeature.name: Weapon Focus
entries: You turn your weapon into an arcane focus for your Spellblade spells.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Eyes
entries: You gain the ability to see in the dark. You have darkvision out to a range of 60 feet during the effect.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Style
entries: While this Aegis is active, you gain one Fighting Style option of your choice from the Fighter class. If you already have a style, the one you choose must be different.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Skill
entries: You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice.

optionalfeature.name: Blade Channel
entries: When you can cast a spell using Spellstrike, you can use the ability modifier used to attack with that weapon instead of your Intelligence for the spellcasting ability modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Illusionary Ally
entries: When you roll initiative, you create a single duplicate as per the {@spell mirror image|PHB} spell. You can only have one duplicate at a time from this effect. If you cast mirror image during the effect, the spell remains the same, but the first time an image is lost, this duplicate is destroyed instead.

optionalfeature.name: Loyal Weapon
entries: A weapon you touch as part of selecting this Aegis is under the effect of {@spell returning weapon|KT-CLL}.

optionalfeature.name: Quickened Movement
entries: Your movement speed is increased by 5 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Aether Barrier
entries: When you deal damage with your Aether Blade, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Overflow
entries: You gain an additional use of your Arcane Surge feature.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Shield
entries: You can create a shield of arcane power that protects you, blocking incoming attacks. You gain a +2 to AC as if you had a shield equipped. This counts as an equipped shield but does not require the use of your hand, and you cannot benefit from both this and an equipped shield.

optionalfeature.name: Blastwave
entries: Whenever you teleport using an Arcane Surge or a spell of 1st level or higher spell during the effect, your Aegis sends out a wave of power. Creatures of your choice within 5 feet of your destination must make a Strength saving throw against your Spell Save DC or be knocked prone.

optionalfeature.name: Chameleon Aegis
entries: You can hide without cover, and do not become immediately revealed when in line of sight of a creature. If you move while a creature can see you, you must pass an additional Dexterity (Stealth) check to remain hidden.

optionalfeature.name: Contingent Blink
entries: The first time you would drop to 0 hit points as a result of taking damage, you instead drop to 1 hit point, and vanish from your plane of existence, appearing on the Ethereal Plane. At the start of your turn, you return to an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within 10 feet of the space you vanished from. Once triggered, this cannot be triggered again until you complete a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Reflective Aegis
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against spells that effect a line, and when you pass a saving throw against a spell that deals damage, you reflect part of the damage causing the caster to take half the damage failing the spell save would have dealt to you.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Resistance
entries: You gain resistance to acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder damage during the effect. You may select a new damage type when you select this Aegis again.

optionalfeature.name: Combat Contingency
entries: You incorporate a contingency for rapidly deploying combat magic into your Aegis. When you roll initiative, as a reaction you can cast one spell of 3rd level or lower spell that affects only you and has a casting time of 1 action.

optionalfeature.name: Dimensional Pathways
entries: When you use Arcane Surge to teleport, you can take one willing Medium or smaller creature within 5 feet of you with you, teleporting them to within 5 feet of your destination.

optionalfeature.name: Phantom Aegis
entries: You can move in brief bursts of intangibility. You can move through the spaces of other creatures (allied or hostile) without any penalty to your movement, and can pass through objects and non-magical barriers as thick as 1 inch.

optionalfeature.name: Runic Strength
entries: Your Strength score becomes equal to your Intelligence score during the effect.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Flight
entries: You gain a flying speed of 30 feet during the effect.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Alacrity
entries: When you take the{@action Attack}action, you can attack twice, instead of once.

optionalfeature.name: Resilient Aegis
entries: You gain proficiency in one Saving Throw of your choice during the effect.

optionalfeature.name: Stone Aegis
entries: You reduce all damage taken by 5.

optionalfeature.name: Balanced Assault
entries: You gain the {@optfeature Two Weapon Fighting Style|KT-CLL}. Two-Weapon Fighting: When you engage in two-weapon fighting, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack.

optionalfeature.name: Create Barrier
entries: When you take the attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with manifesting an elemental barrier in an unoccupied space on the ground within 30 feet of you. This elemental barrier forms out of nearby materials (such as dirt, wood, or stone), and cannot be formed in the absence of natural materials. The barrier roughly blocks a 5 foot cube of space, and has an AC of 15, and hit points equal to 10 + your Warden level. You can have a number of these created equal to your proficiency bonus. When creating a new one beyond your limit, the oldest previously created one crumbles.
Based on your subclass, you may be able to create other kinds of barriers:

items: {@b Astral Barrier.} (Prerequisite: {@subclass Astral Guardian|Warden|KT-CLL} subclass) The barrier does not require any nearby materials to form from.

{@b Ice Barrier.} (Prerequisite: {@subclass Elemental Soul|Warden|KT-CLL} subclass) The barrier does not require any nearby natural materials to form from, and deals 1d6 cold damage to any creature that attacks it.
{@b Iron Barrier.} (Prerequisite: {@subclass Ironbound|Warden|KT-CLL} subclass) The barrier has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

{@b Tree Barrier.} (Prerequisite: {@subclass Elderheart|Warden|KT-CLL} subclass) The barrier does not require any nearby natural materials to form from, has hit points equal to 10 + twice your Warden level, and can form up to 20 feet tall.
{@b Stone Barrier.} (Prerequisite: {@subclass Stoneblood|Warden|KT-CLL} subclass) The barrier has an AC equal to your AC (unless it is already higher).

entries: You can create a total number of barriers equal to your Warden level before you must complete a short or long rest to more.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Rebuke
entries: You learn the spell {@spell Aldricor's elemental rebuke|TheArenaGuy}. You don't need any components to cast it, and can cast it once without expending a spell slot. Once you do so, you cannot do so again until you complete a long rest. You can cast it again early be expending 2 Endurance Dice.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of Life
entries: As an action, you can expend an {@classFeature Endurance Dice|Warden|KT-CLL|2|KT-CLL|Endurance Die} to heal a creature you touch for 1 hit point and give them a number of temporary hit points equal to a roll of your Endurance Die + your Wisdom modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Guided Wrath
entries: When you make an attack with a natural weapon granted by this class, you can use your Wisdom modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls.
Based on your subclass, you may gain additional benefits:

items: {@b Living Weapons} (Prerequisite: Elderheart subclass). You can use your Wisdom modifier, instead of your Strength, to initiate and maintain {@action grapple} checks made with your Lashing Vines.

{@b Living Chains} (Prerequisite: Ironbound subclass). You can use your Wisdom modifier, instead of your Strength, to initiate and maintain grapple checks made with the Chains created with Binding Interdiction.
{@b Living Arms} (Prerequisite: Astral Guardian subclass). You can use your Wisdom modifier, instead of your Strength, to initiate and maintain grapple checks with your Astral Arms.

optionalfeature.name: Engulfing Vines
entries: You can grapple a number of creatures with each of your Lashing Vines equal to your Wisdom modifier. While it is not grappling the maximum number of targets, it can attack creatures you are not grappling with it. Additionally, at the start of your turn, you can pull any creature grappled by your Lashing Vines 5 feet towards you (no action required).

optionalfeature.name: Heart of the Storm
entries: You gain resistance to damage from area of effect spells cast by allied creatures. If you would normally resist the damage, you take no damage from the spell instead.

optionalfeature.name: Karmic Edict
entries: The spell {@spell karmic reflection|PHB} is added to your innate spells, allowing you to cast it once for free without expending a spell slot or endurance dice, regaining the ability to do so again on a long rest. You can cast it early by spending {@classFeature Endurance Dice|Warden|KT-CLL|2}.

optionalfeature.name: Mystic Deflection
entries: Your AC is increased by 1 while you are wearing light or medium armor.

optionalfeature.name: Mystic Reinforcement
entries: The damage reduction granted by {@classFeature Mystic Bulwark|Warden|KT-CLL|1} increases by 1.

optionalfeature.name: Primal Intuition
entries: You gain a {@sense blindsight|PHB} out to a range of 10 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Protective Interdiction
entries: If an allied creature within range of your {@classFeature Primal Interdiction|Warden|KT-CLL|2} takes nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage, you can use your reaction to reduce the damage taken by twice the damage reduction of your {@classFeature Mystic Bulwark|Warden|KT-CLL|1}.

optionalfeature.name: Reliable Endurance
entries: When you roll an {@classFeature Endurance Dice|Warden|KT-CLL|2|KT-CLL|Endurance Die}, you can replace the die with {@dice 2d4} (becoming {@dice 1d4 + 1d6} when the die becomes a d10, and {@dice 3d4} when the die becomes a d12).

optionalfeature.name: Temporal Torsion
entries: As an attack as part of the attack action, you can violent distort time for a creature within 30 feet, causing be displaced from reality. The target must make a Charisma saving throw, taking 1d8 + your Wisdom modifier necrotic damage and having their movement speed reduced by 10 feet on failed saving throw. The damage of this ability is increased by any effect that increases the damage of your natural weapons.

optionalfeature.name: Time Trick
entries: You gain the ability greatly speed up your own actions within narrow limitations, allowing you to very quickly don or doff, change clothes, or complete simple task that would take less than a minute in an action. You cannot move from your space, interact with other creatures, cast spells, attack, or make ability checks during this action.
You can use this ability an number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier, regaining all uses on a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Unrelenting Onslaught
entries: If you cast a spell as an action, you can make a single weapon attack with a natural weapon as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Well of Fortitude
entries: When you complete a short rest, you can roll 1 hit die for free without expending it. You can do this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus before you need to complete a long rest to do so again, but not more than once per short rest.

optionalfeature.name: Wildheart
entries: For all Beast type creatures of a CR equal to your Warden level, you are under the effect of sanctuary. You gain advantage on Animal Handling checks, or checks to persuade, deter, or seek help from beasts.

optionalfeature.name: Sacrificing Stance
entries: When you roll a saving throw against an area of effect spell or magical effect that does damage, you can roll your save with disadvantage to shield your allies.
When you do so allied creatures in the area of your {@classFeature Primal Interdiction|Warden|KT-CLL|2} gain resistance to the damage taken from the effect.

optionalfeature.name: Savage Weapons
entries: The damage dice of all natural weapons granted by the class increases by 1 size (for example, a d6 becomes a d8). If a weapon has multiple dice, only one die increases.

optionalfeature.name: Devouring Earth
entries: You can cast {@spell quicksand|KT-CLL} without expending a spell slot. Once you do so, you cannot do so again until you complete a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Falling Sky
entries: You can cast {@spell sleet storm|PHB} without expending a spell slot. Once you do so, you cannot do so again until you complete a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: One With Stone
entries: You can cast {@spell meld into stone|PHB} without expending a spell slot. Once you do so, you cannot do so again until you complete a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Arise Stone
entries: You can cast {@spell wall of stone|PHB} without expending a spell slot. Once you do so, you cannot do so again until you complete a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Crushing Grip
entries: At the start of your turn, you deal {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage to all creatures you are grappling.

optionalfeature.name: Font of Will
entries: When you would make a saving throw at the end of your turn, you can instead make that saving throw at the start of your turn.

optionalfeature.name: Revitalizing Endurance
entries: When you start your turn with 0 hit points, you can expend an {@classFeature Endurance Dice|Warden|KT-CLL|2|KT-CLL|Endurance Die}, rolling it and regaining hit points equal to the number rolled.

optionalfeature.name: Unlimited Endurance
entries: You gain an additional {@classFeature Endurance Dice|Warden|KT-CLL|2|KT-CLL|Endurance Die}.

optionalfeature.name: Arise Thorns
entries: You can cast {@spell wall of thorns|PHB} without expending a spell slot. Once you do so, you cannot do so again until you complete a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Arise Ice
entries: You can cast {@spell wall of ice|PHB} without expending a spell slot. Once you do so, you cannot do so again until you complete a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Immortal Body
entries: If you start your turn with less than half your hit points, you regain {@dice 1d6} hit points. You don't gain this benefit if you have 0 hit points.

optionalfeature.name: Last Stand
entries: At the end of your turn, you can start a Last Stand. Until the start of your next turn, any damage taken by allied creatures within 60 feet that would reduce them below 1 hit point is instead taken by you. This effect ends if you fall {@condition unconscious|PHB}.
Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Planar Guardian
entries: You can cast the spell {@spell plane shift|PHB} without expending a spell slot. You can only target willing creatures when you cast it this way. Once you do so, you cannot do so again until you complete a long rest.

item.name: Occult Fetish
entries: Similar to a {@item Holy Symbol|PHB} or an {@item Arcane Focus|PHB}, an Occult Fetish is a magical focus, but one that functions for the {@class Occultist|KT-CLL}.
It can be almost anything, though usually has a somewhat macabre bent, such as a skull decorated with feathers or pendant decorated with teeth and runes.
You can buy or make one for 10 gp, and it typically weighs about 1 lb.

feat.name: Athlete
entries: You can accomplish mythical feats of athletic prowess. You gain the following benefits:

items: Ability Score Increase. Increase your Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution by 1, to a maximum of 20.
Athletic Movement. Gain your choice of a climbing speed or swimming speed equal to your movement speed.
Gain the Athletic Feat special ability (below).

entries.name: Athletic Feat
entries: You can perform an outrageous athletic feat. You can do any of the following during your turn:

items: Jump a distance equal to your movement speed.
Lift twice your normal lifting capacity until the end of your turn.
Move at normal speed while carrying or dragging another creature until the end of your turn.
Make a free Strength or Dexterity saving throw or ability check against an ongoing effect or spell effecting you that would normally take an action or only occur at the end of your turn
Take the {@action Dash} action as a bonus action.

entries: Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest. You can use the feature again before completing a rest by taking a level of exhaustion.

feat.name: Bodyguard

otherSummary.entrySummary: Fighting style that uses your reaction to defend an allied creature

entries: Your reflexes and techniques safeguard your allies. You gain the following benefits:

items: Ability Score Increase. Increase Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

Leaping Saves. You can move up to 5 feet before using your reaction to protect an ally with a Fighting Style or Feat. Alternatively, when you use a reaction on a Fighting Style to defend an allied creature while you are already adjacent to them, you can swap positions with that ally after the attack completes as long as your movement speed isn't zero. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
Gain the Heroic Intervention special reaction (below).

entries.name: Heroic Intervention
entries: As a reaction, when an allied creature within range of your movement speed would take damage, you can move to them and into their space. If the damage came from an attack, you become the target of the attack.

They move to an unoccupied space of their choice within 5 feet, or the closest unoccupied space if there are no unoccupied spaces within 5 feet (potentially moving them out of an area of effect, but moving yourself into it).
You and the target creature have resistance to all damage until the start of your next turn.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

feat.name: Breaker
entries: You master the breaking of any creature within your grasp. You gain the following benefits:

items: {@b Ability Score Increase.} Increase your Strength or Constitution score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
{@b Punishing Blows.} You have advantage on attack rolls against a creature you are {@condition grappled|PHB|grappling}.
Gain the {@b Merciless Break} special attack (below)

entries.name: Merciless Break
entries: {@italic Active Ability (Attack)}
When you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks to inflict a debilitating injury on a creature you are {@condition grappled|PHB|grappling}.

The creature takes {@damage 2d6} + your Strength modifier bludgeoning damage and suffers an injury for 1 minute. The number of d6 increases by one when your proficiency bonus increases (with the total number of d6 equaling your proficiency bonus). While suffering from this injury, the creature subtracts 1d6 from attack rolls and ability checks, and must pass a DC 10 Constitution saving throw to successfully cast a spell.

The target creature makes a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect of the injury on a success. A creature can spend their action treating their injury to automatically pass the saving throw.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

feat.name: Brute
entries: Your attacks leave your enemies devastated and cowering in fear. You gain the following benefits:

items: {@b Ability Score Increase.} Increase your Strength or Constitution score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
{@b Brutal Effort.} When you roll damage for a melee weapon attack, you can reroll the weapon's damage dice and use either total.
Gain the {@b Brutal Threat} special attack (below)

entries.name: Brutal Threat
entries: {@italic Active Ability (Attack)}

When you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks to issue a dire threat backed by your killing intent at a creature that can see or hear you within 60 feet. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw.

On failure, they become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. If it fails by 5 or more, it becomes frozen in terror, suffering the {@condition paralyzed} condition while it is frightened. A frightened creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on success (if it fails by less than 5 it can end the paralyze effect, but cannot become paralyzed after the initial save).

If you kill a target while it is frightened in this way, you can repeat this action as a reaction targeting another creature within 30 feet that can see or hear you bypassing the usual usage restriction of the feature.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

feat.name: Charger
entries: You master the reckless rush of smashing into the enemy line. You gain the following benefits:

items: {@b Ability Score Increase.} Increase your Strength or Constitution score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
{@b Heavy Momentum.} If you move at least 20 feet in a direction before making your first melee weapon attack roll on your turn, the attack deals an additional {@damage 1d8} damage.
Gain the {@b Wild Charge} special attack (below).

entries.name: Wild Charge
entries: {@italic Active Ability (Attack)}

When you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with making a charge. You or a mount you are controlling can move up to 30 feet in a straight line, flinging your enemies out of your path.

This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity. Large or smaller creatures in your path must make a Strength saving throw, or be knocked out of your way and prone. If a creature has no where they can move, they are knocked {@condition prone} but not moved, and you pass over them. A creature takes {@damage 2d6} + your Strength modifier bludgeoning damage on a failed save. The number of d6 increases by one when your proficiency bonus increases (with the total number of d6 equaling your proficiency bonus). Your charge ends early if a creature passes their save. Creatures with a CR equal to less than half of your character level automatically fail their save.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

feat.name: Destroyer
entries: You bring ruin to the battlefield, cleaving through hordes. You gain the following benefits:

items: {@b Ability Score Increase.} Increase your Strength or Constitution score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

{@b Cleaving Blows.} When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with an attack, you can apply any overflow damage (damage dealt by the attack over what was required to bring the target to zero) to another creature within 5 feet of the target, if the attack roll would also hit that target.
Gain the {@b Whirlwind Slash} special attack (below).

entries.name: Whirlwind Slash
entries: {@italic Active Ability (Attack)}

When you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with spinning your weapon in a massive arc with great force. All creatures of your choice within 5 feet of you must make a Dexterity saving throw. On failure, they take {@damage 2d6} + your Strength modifier damage, or half as much on a successful save. The number of d6 increases by one when your proficiency bonus increases (with the total number of d6 equaling your proficiency bonus).
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

feat.name: Durable
entries: You possess an implausible resilience and are capable of amazing feats of endurance. You gain the following benefits:

items: {@b Ability Score Increase.} Increase your Strength or Constitution score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
{@b Rapid Recovery.} When you roll a Hit Die to regain hit points, the minimum number of hit points you regain from the roll equals twice your Constitution modifier (minimum of 2).
Gain the {@b Unyielding Endurance} special reaction (below)

entries.name: Unyielding Endurance
entries: {@italic Active Ability (Reaction)}

As a reaction to taking damage, you can brace yourself to weather the blow and any additional blows. Until the start of your next turn, you can reduce all damage taken (including from the damage that triggered this reaction) by your Proficiency bonus and gain advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws. Additionally for the duration, if an attack would reduce you to 0, you can make a Constitution saving throw with a DC to the amount of damage taken. On a success, you are reduced to 1 instead. If you are not incapacitated at the start of your next turn after using this feature, you can expend a number of hit dice up to your proficiency bonus, rolling them to regain hit points as normal
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

feat.name: Grappler
entries: You master grappling and leverage to pin and fling your foes. You gain the following benefits:

items: {@b Ability Score Increase.} Increase your Strength or Constitution by 1, to a maximum of 20.
{@b Quick Grabs.} When you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can make one unarmed strike or attempt to {@action Grapple} as a bonus action.
Gain the {@b Martial Toss} special attack (below).

entries.name: Martial Toss
entries: {@italic Active Ability (Attack)}

When you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks to attempt to hurl a creature of your size or smaller. The target must make a Strength saving throw. An object or creature you are grappling automatically fails. If you successfully lift them, you can throw them 20 feet. The range is increased by 10 feet for each size smaller than you the target is.

The creature's movement ends early if it collides with another creature or obstacle. The thrown creature and anything it collides with takes {@damage 2d6} + your Strength modifier, and the thrown creature falls prone. The number of d6 increases by one when your proficiency bonus increases (with the total number of d6 equaling your proficiency bonus).
A creature can choose to fail their save against this ability. You can throw a willing creature more carefully, dealing no damage to them unless they collide with something during their flight.
Once you use this feature to successfully throw a creature or object, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

feat.name: Line Breaker
entries: You smash through your enemies, clearing the way for your allies.

items: {@b Ability Score Increase.} Increase your Strength or Constitution by 1, to a maximum of 20.

{@b Heavy Impacts.} When you push a creature, if the creature's movement is stopped early by another creature, object, or terrain, they take {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage for each 5 feet moved before the collision.
Gain the {@b Might Impact} special attack (below).

entries.name: Mighty Impact
entries: {@italic Active Ability (Attack)}

When you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks to slam an enemy backwards. The target must make a Strength saving throw. On failure, it takes {@damage 2d6} + your Strength modifier damage and is pushed 15 feet away from you. On a success, it takes half as much damage and is pushed 5 feet away from you. The distance the target is pushed is reduced by 5 feet for every size larger than you it is. The number of d6 increases by one when your proficiency bonus increases (with the total number of d6 equaling your proficiency bonus).
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

feat.name: Ruffian
entries: You have turned kicking people when they're down into an art form. You gain the following benefits:

items: {@b Ability Score Increase.} Increase your Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution by 1, to a maximum of 20.

{@b Painful Critical.} When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack against a creature, it must make a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition blinded} or dazed until the start of your next turn. This does not affect undead, constructs, or other creatures that can feel no pain.
Gain the {@b Dirty Strike} special ability (below)

entries.name: Dirty Strike
entries: {@italic Active Ability (Special)}

When you make a melee weapon attack, you can follow up with a dirty trick (a knee to the gut, handful of sand to eyes, etc.). The creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On failure, they become your choice of {@condition blinded} or dazed{@sup } (your choice) for 1 minute. The target can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of their turns. A creature can spend their action treating their condition to automatically pass the saving throw. Once you use this against a target once, they are ready for subsequent attempts and automatically pass saving throws against it.
Once you use this feature to successfully blind or daze a creature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

entries.name: {@sup }Dazed Condition
entries: A dazed creature can only do one of the following: move, take its action, or take a bonus action. It cannot take reactions.

items: {@b Ability Score Increase.} Increase your Strength, Dexterity or Constitution by 1, to a maximum of 20.

{@b Raining Death.} If you kill a creature within a single ranged weapon attack (reducing it from maximum hit points to 0 hit points) using the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can make one additional ranged weapon attack as a bonus action that turn.
Gain the {@b Arrow Storm} special attack (below)

entries.name: Arrow Storm
entries: {@italic Active Ability (Attack)}

When you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks by firing innumerable pieces of ammunition into the sky which rain down around a point within 60 feet of you. All creatures within 10 feet of the point must make a Dexterity saving throw. On failure, they take {@damage 2d6} + your Dexterity modifier damage, or half as much on success. The number of d6 increases by one when your proficiency bonus increases (with the total number of d6 equaling your proficiency bonus).
A number of pieces of ammunition are consumed equal to the number of targets that make the save against the ability times two.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

feat.name: Striker
entries: You move like the wind, striking faster than your foes can see. You gain the following benefits:

items: {@b Ability Score Increase.} Increase your Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

{@b Battlefield Dancer.} Each time you hit a creature, your movement speed increases by 5 feet until the end of your turn. If you attack and hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can pass through its space, treating it as difficult terrain.
Gain the {@b Slashing Dash} special attack (below)

entries.name: Slashing Dash
entries: {@italic Active Ability (Attack)}
When you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with a rapid burst of movement, moving up to 30 feet along any surface in a straight line.

You can move on vertical or horizontal surfaces with this movement, can pass through creatures, and do not provoke attacks of opportunity, but cannot pass through objects or terrain. If you are carrying a weapon you are proficient with when you take this action, each time you pass through a creature, it must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 2d6} + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice) damage of your weapon type on a failed save, or half as much on a successful save. The number of d6 increases by one when your proficiency bonus increases (with the total number of d6 equaling your proficiency bonus).
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

feat.name: Weapon Thrower
entries: You excel at hurling objects, with a remarkably lack of concern for aerodynamics.

items: {@b Ability Score Increase.} Increase your Strength or Constitution by 1, to a maximum of 20.
{@b Reckless Aerodynamics.} All melee weapons gain the thrown 20/60 property for you, unless they already had the thrown property with a greater range.
Gain the {@b Thunderbolt Throw} special attack (below)

entries.name: Thunderbolt Throw
entries: {@italic Active Ability (Attack)}

When you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks to hurl a Small or smaller object (including weapons for creatures of Medium size) at a target. Make an attack treating the object as a simple melee weapon with the thrown 60/180 property unless it already has a longer thrown range. On hit, the creature takes {@damage 2d6} + your Strength modifier bludgeoning damage (replaced by the weapons damage type when throwing a weapon) and must make a Constitution saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and dazed{@sup }. The number of d6 increases by one when your proficiency bonus increases (with the total number of d6 equaling your proficiency bonus).
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

entries.name: {@sup }Dazed Condition
entries: A dazed creature can only do one of the following: move, take its action, or take a bonus action. It cannot take reactions.

feat.name: Axe Expert
entries: You wield an axe like a force of nature, maximizing and embodying its relentless and unstoppable power. You gain the following benefits:

entries.name: Axe Rush
entries: While wielding a handaxe, battleaxe, or greataxe, you can use a bonus action to move up to 5 feet and add {@damage 1d6} to your next attack and damage roll with an axe.

feat.name: Bow Expert
entries: Your relentless practice with a bow grants you the following benefits while using one:

entries.name: Ranging Shots
entries: When you miss a ranged weapon attack with a bow, your next ranged weapon attack roll with a bow has advantage.

entries.name: Overwatch
entries: As a bonus action, you can ready a shot until the start of your next turn. If a creature moves 5 feet or more while within 30 feet of you while you have a shot readied, you can use your reaction to make a ranged weapon attack against that creature with a -5 penalty to the attack roll.

feat.name: Dagger Expert
entries: You wield daggers with perfection and poise, able to use them fluidly in any situation.

entries.name: Dagger Tricks
entries: You can draw or stow any number of daggers during your turn. You have advantage on any ability check to conceal your daggers.

entries.name: Improved Critical
entries: Your attacks with daggers score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

entries.name: Swift Stabbing
entries: When you use two-weapon fighting using a dagger in both hands, you can take both attacks as part of the {@action Attack} action on your turn (without expending your bonus action). You can only make this attack once per turn.

feat.name: Flail Expert
entries: Your mastery with a flail allows you to use the challenging weapon with deadly skill. You gain the following benefits while wielding a flail:

entries.name: Dangerous Swings
entries: When you miss a melee weapon attack made with a flail, you can make a new attack roll against another creature you of your choice within the weapon's range. You cannot attack the same creature twice this way.

entries.name: Wind Up
entries: As a bonus action, you can whirl the flail building momentum. The next attack you make with it before the end of your turns an additional {@damage 1d8} damage on hit.

feat.name: Harpoon Expert
entries: You are resourceful and skilled when it comes the use of harpoons, gaining the following benefits:

entries.name: Throwing Arm
entries: The normal range of your thrown weapons is doubled.

entries.name: Harpoon
entries: As an action, you can use 30 feet of rope to turn any javelin, spear, or trident into a harpoon. When you throw that harpoon at a target 30 feet or less from you, you can pull it back to your hand as a bonus action. If the attack hit the target and the target is no more than one size larger than you, when you pull the harpoon back to you, you can force the target to make a Strength saving throw against a DC of 8 + your Strength modifier + your proficiency bonus. On failure, you drag the target up to 20 feet toward you.

feat.name: Impact Expert
entries: You have mastered heavy blows with bludgeoning weapons. When you hit a creature with a maul or greatclub, you gain a charge of momentum until the end of your current turn. You can expend your momentum charges as a bonus action on one of the following abilities.

entries.name: Knock Back
entries: Requires 1 or more charges of momentum: You push a creature within reach of you 5 feet per charge of momentum directly away from you. The distance they are pushed decreases by 5 feet for every size larger than you they are (for example, if you are Medium pushing a Large creature, you need to push them 10 feet to move them 5 feet).

entries.name: Take Down
entries: Requires 2 charges of momentum: You force a creature within reach of you to make a Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Bonk!
entries: Requires 1 or more charges of momentum: You expend the momentum slamming into a creature within 5 feet of you, dealing 1d4 bludgeoning damage per charge of momentum.

feat.name: Lance Master
entries: You use maximize the effectiveness of a lance, gaining the following benefits:

entries.name: Impaled Movement
entries: While you are mounted, if you strike a creature smaller than your mount with a lance, you can push that creature until the end of your turn, you make another attack, or you move in something other than a straight line. This movement counts as if you are grappling the creature for the duration of the movement, and your mounts movement speed is reduced to half while pushing them.

entries.name: Piercing Charge
entries: When you hit an attack with a lance after traveling at least 10 feet, you can make an additional attack at another creature behind the target hit with disadvantage, as long as they are in reach of your weapon (you can move between attacks, but only in a straight line) with disadvantage. You can continue to repeat this until you miss, run out of movement, or run out of creatures in a line to hit.

entries.name: Expert Handling
entries: A lance no longer requires two-hands when you aren't mounted.

feat.name: Morning Star Expert
entries: You have mastered the use of a morning star, and are able to leverage greater effectiveness from it. You gain the following features:

items: {@b Ability Score Increase.} Increase your Strength or Constitution ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
{@b Improved Critical.} Your attacks with morning stars score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

{@b Rend.} Your critical strikes wound the target. The target loses 1d10 hit points at the end of each of their turns until the wound is healed. The target or any creature within 5 feet of it can make a DC 10 Wisdom (Medicine) check as an action to heal the wound.

feat.name: Natural Weapon Expert

otherSummary.entrySummary: Have one or more natural weapons

entries: You master the use of your natural weapons, granting you the following benefits:

items: {@b Ferocity.} As a bonus action, you can make a single weapon attack with your natural weapon.
{@b Natural Perfection.} Your natural weapon damage die increases to 1d6. If it is already 1d6 or greater, it increases by d2 (or one step higher), up to a maximum of 1d12.

feat.name: Pike Master
entries: You master the effective use of a pike, making the most of its extreme range.

items: {@b Extended Reach.} Your reach with a pike increases by 5 feet on your turn.

{@b Set for Charge.} If you haven't yet moved this turn, you can use your bonus action to set for charge, reducing your movement speed to 0 and gaining a second reaction that can only be used to make attacks of opportunity until the start of your next turn.
{@b Zone Control.} While wielding a pike, creatures provoke an attack of opportunity when they enter the reach of the pike.

feat.name: Stinger
entries: You specialize in the quiet and agonizing kill with subtle weapons. You gain the following benefits related to blowguns and darts:

items: {@b Ability Score Increase.} Increase your Dexterity, Wisdom, or Constitution ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
{@b Efficient Poisons.} When you apply a poison blowgun needle or dart, you can apply it to twice as many pieces of ammunition.

{@b Hidden Death.} If you attack while hidden from a target with a blowgun or dart, you can make a Dexterity (Stealth) check with a −5 penalty for each time you've hit the target this turn against their passive Wisdom (Perception) score (no action required). On a success, you remain hidden from that target, though the target will know which general direction you are in.

feat.name: Swordmaster
entries: Your swordplay leverages every advantage to build momentum, allowing you to strike or defend in new ways. When wielding a sword, you gain a special Swordplay d6 die each time you successfully attack a creature with it. You can have a maximum number of Swordplay dice equal to your proficiency bonus. You lose all accumulated dice if you stop wielding a sword or end your turn without making an attack with a sword.
You can spend your Swordplay dice on the following abilities:

entries.name: Sword Parry
entries: As a reaction to being hit by a melee weapon attack, you can expend your Swordplay dice, rolling them and reducing the damage taken by the amount rolled. If the amount rolled exceeds the damage taken, the attacker takes damage equal to the difference.

entries.name: Sword Finisher
entries: As a bonus action when you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend your Swordplay dice, rolling them and dealing additional damage equal to the roll.

feat.name: Warhammer Expert
entries: Your mastery over a warhammer ensures that your blows never fail to wear down the enemy, becoming an inexorable threat to any foe. You gain the following benefits:

items: {@b Ability Score Increase.} Increase your Strength or Constitution ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

{@b Battering Blows.} When you miss a melee weapon attack with the warhammer, the target takes half the weapon damage the attack would have dealt. This does not count as a hit for things that require you to hit the target (such as spells, Divine Smite, or similar features), but does include modifiers to the attack damage roll.

feat.name: War Pick Expert
entries: You have mastered the use of a war pick, and are able to tear down the most formidable foes.

items: {@b Ability Score Increase.} Increase your Strength or Constitution ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
{@b Siege Pick.} Attacks you make with the war pick against objects deal double damage.

{@b Sunder.} When you hit a target that is wearing armor or benefiting from natural armor, you can use your bonus action to sunder the target, temporarily leaving them vulnerable. The next attack roll against that creature has advantage.

feat.name: Whip Expert
entries: You master using a whip, gaining the following benefits:

items: {@b Ability Score Bonus.} Increase your Strength, Dexterity or Constitution ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

{@b Expert Handling.} Whips gain the Light property for you and you can use a whip to extend your reach for certain object interactions, such as opening and closing doors, picking up objects, or similar simple interactions.
{@b Whip Tricks.} You gain the Whip Tricks special attacks.

entries: Whip Tricks
You master the manipulation of a whip to allow a level of extreme control over its use.

When you make a weapon attack with a whip, you can replace the attack with a trick, forcing the enemy to make a Dexterity saving throw saving with a DC of 8 + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice) + your proficiency bonus. If the target fails its saving throw, you can perform any of the following tricks against it:

items: {@b Sudden Yank.} You wrap the whip around a Medium or smaller target, and yank them 5 feet towards you.

{@b Tangle Weapon.} You tangle one weapon the target is wielding, giving them disadvantage on attacks with that weapon until the start of your next turn, or until they miss an attack. You cannot make attacks with the whip used to make the attack until they free the weapon.
{@b Whip Trip.} You tangle a Large or smaller creature's feet, causing them to fall prone

feat.name: Versatile Weapon Master
entries: You are an expert on the fluid use of versatile weapons, changing stances to fit any situation. When you draw a versatile weapon you are proficient with, or start your turn while wielding one, you can enter a special stance as long as you aren't wielding other weapons or a shield.

This lasts until the start of your next turn, drop or sheath your weapon, or equip a shield. Each stance provides modifiers to your melee weapon attacks made with the versatile weapon while in that stance:

items: {@b Neutral Stance:} You add +1 to your attack rolls, damage rolls, and armor class.
{@b Power Stance:} You don't add your Proficiency bonus to attack rolls, but add twice your Proficiency bonus to your damage rolls.
{@b Accuracy Stance:} You add twice your Proficiency bonus to attack rolls (instead of just your Proficiency Bonus, but don't add your ability modifier to damage rolls.

{@b Defensive Stance:} You don't add your Proficiency bonus to attack rolls, but if you hit at least one attack against a hostile creature, you can add your proficiency bonus to your AC until the start of your next turn.
{@b Quick Draw.} Whenever you make an attack, you can draw a light melee weapon as part of taking the attack.

{@b Twin Strike.} When you make an attack while wielding more than one light melee weapon and make an attack with one of them, you can subtract the damage dice of another light melee weapon you are carrying from the attack roll to add twice its damage dice to the damage roll of that attack on hit.

feat.name: One with Wind
entries: You have mastered the supernatural ability striking like the wind, gaining the following benefits:

items: {@b Ability Score Bonus.} Increase your Strength, Dexterity, or Wisdom ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
{@b Wind Walker.} You are not affected by difficult terrain or additional movement costs when the difficult terrain or movement cost comes from strong winds (such as the gust of wind spell).
You gain the {@b Wind Strike} special attack (below).

entries.name: Wind Strike
entries: {@italic Active Ability (Attack, Supernatural)}

When you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with a special attack that lets you vanish into the wind before striking a number of nearby creatures with a weapon you are carrying in a flurry of blows, before reform from the wind within 5 feet of one of the creatures attacked. You can attack a number of creatures in this way equal to your proficiency bonus, but can only strike each creature once. You can strike creatures within a range of 5  your proficiency bonus feet (for example when you proficiency bonus is +2, you can strike creatures within 10 feet).

Each time you strike a creature, make a melee weapon attack, dealing {@damage 1d6} + your Mystic Path modifier damage on a hit. The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} each time your proficiency bonus increases.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

entries.name: Wind Affinity
entries: You are touched by the winds, either from a blessing of a powerful entity or through focused mastery and study of their essence, allowing you to borrow and harness their power.

You learn the {@spell windborne weapon|KT-CLL} and {@spell manipulate wind|SpellsThatDontSuck} cantrips and the {@spell become wind|KT-CLL} spell. You can cast it innately without expending a spell slot once, regaining the ability to so when you complete a short or long rest. When you cast it this way, you cast it a level equal to your proficiency bonus.

feat.name: Wind Slash
entries: The wind conveys the will of your attacks, granting you the following benefits:

items: {@b Ability Score Bonus.} Increase your Strength, Dexterity or Wisdom ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

{@b Cloudbreaker.} You can cut dust, fog, or clouds. As an attack as part of the attack action, you can clear a 30 foot cone of dust, fog, or cloud. Depending on the source of the obscuring effect, the area may become obscured again after {@dice 1d4} rounds.
You gain the {@b Wind Slash} special attack (below).

entries.name: Wind Slash
entries: {@italic Active Ability (Attack, Supernatural)}

When you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with a special attack, launching a blades of wind at targets within 60 feet. You launch a number of blades equal to your proficiency modifier, but can increase the number of attacks made by giving up additional attacks you can make as part of the {@action Attack} action (launching one additional attack for each attack forgone). The blades are ranged weapon attacks using your Mystic Path modifier. Each blade deals {@damage 1d6} + your Mystic Path modifier slashing damage on damage on hit.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

feat.name: Fire Dancer
entries: You've danced among the flames so long and with such skill that now the flames dance along with you. You gain the following benefits:

items: {@b Ability Score Bonus.} Increase your Strength, Dexterity, or Charisma ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
{@b Through The Flames.} You have advantage on Dexterity saving throws where failing them would result in taking fire damage.
You gain the {@b Cinder Sweep} special attack (below).

entries.name: Cinder Sweep
entries: {@italic Active Ability (Attack, Supernatural)}

When you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with moving up to 5 feet without provoking attacks of opportunity and then cause an explosion of fire around you. All creatures within 10 feet of you must make a Dexterity saving throw. On failure, a creature takes {@damage 2d6} fire damage and becomes ignited. Creatures that are ignited take {@damage 1d6} fire damage at the end of each of their turns until a creature within 5 feet of the ignited target spends their action to douse the flames. On success, creatures take half as much damage and are not ignited. The initial fire damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when your proficiency bonus increases.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

feat.name: Burning Soul
entries: You harbor within your soul an ember of the flame of life akin to the power of a phoenix. You gain the following benefits:

items: {@b Ability Score Bonus.} Increase your Strength, Constitution or Charisma ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
{@b Resilient Life.} You gain advantage on death saving throws. If you have Explosive Rejuvenation available when you would fail your 3rd death saving throw, it automatically activates instead.
You gain the {@b Explosive Rejuvenation} special bonus action (below).

entries.name: Explosive Rejuvenation
entries: {@italic Active Ability (Bonus Action, Supernatural)}

As a bonus action, you can unleash the power of the ember within your soul, exploding with fire. You regain {@dice 2d4} hit points, and all creatures within 10 feet of you must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 2d4} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.
The fire damage and hit points regard increase by {@dice 1d4} each time your proficiency increases (remaining equal to your proficiency bonus).
Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.
You are granted a special affinity with fire, allowing you to borrow and harness its power.
